To get an audio guide in English you need to buy a ticket for it at the ticket booth then go to the administration booth with your ticket to pick it up. You do not go through security then pick it up - as you do for the Russian ones. After we saw the Palace we went for a walk around the grounds. It's probably more impressive I summer but was still very nice. For lunch we went somewhere just outside called BakenBards. It was upstairs nearby and had free wifi. The cafe inside Catherine Palace did not look very appetising. To get back we caught the 545 bus in a slightly different place to where we had been dropped off, kind of around the corner. I imagine the Palace gets very busy in the height of summer, but there weren't too many tourists to enjoy it when we went.
Very beautiful place!. Nice place to visit anytime, but I like in summer time. A place full of history. Отличное место для отдыха и прогулок,шикарный парк и дворец!!!

Gem of European architecture. Accessing by public transport is bit difficult and confusing if you don't speak russian. Recommended to use some private transport or drive is good, i loved the huge building and the restoration is done very well and i hope to visit again.

Incredible. We had a great experience visiting Catherine's Palace which is a fair ways South of St,Petersburg in Pushkin. We got there by taking the subway and then a bus. We were not part of a tour and booked our tickets on-line which allowed us to skip the long line to purchase tickets and to enter right away rather than waiting for a set time. It was a busy time of year and very crowded but worth the trip. Catherine's palace is truly "over the top" in terms of grandeur. Be sure to allow some time to view the photos of the destruction of the area during the war and the reconstruction of parts of the palace. Even better than the palace are themagnificent grounds with its gardens, lakes, pavilions, bath houses and pathways so be sure to allow enough time

Catherine Palace. South of St Petersburg in the town of Puskin is this magnificent palace. It was named after Peter the Great's wife in the mid 18 century. It's sheer size and elegance will take your breath away! The ornate blue building is around a thousand feet long ( 300 metres) Gold domes rise over the chapel.A guided tour takes you through many magnificent rooms including the famous Picture Gallery, the Amber Room, and The Great Hall. The hall is the largest room. The palace is remarkable for its fairy tale interior and fine furniture. The grounds of the palace extend to fifteen hundred acres of landscaped gardens, parkland and pavilions.

Grandeur on an amazing scale.. Let me begin by saying that my husband and I hired a private guide and car for the two days we were in St. Petersburg. It was an expense which paid off in many ways, and one was visiting the Palaces and Museums. We were able to bypass the lines completely, and since our guide was very familiar with the staff @ each venue, we were given some small privileges larger groups were not. With that said, the Palace was stunning beyond words. The attention to detail in each room was flawless. The fireplaces each had their own character despite the similarity of design. Do not miss the Amber room. It is an astonishing display of opulence. It is an experience I will never forget; to see walls covered in every shade of amber imaginable. Each room offers a unique display and style. The gardens are not to be missed. The design of each is unique and worth the wander. Do not let lines or crowds dissuade you, it is a rare opportunity to experience such an amazing venue.

Grand and Glorious...great experience!. Really one of the best days of travel during my trip to Russia. I traveled in mid March so there were very, very few tourists; basically empty at both the Catherine Palace and Pavlovsk Palace. My tour guide, Irina Kazantseva, was absolutely wonderful. She was extremely knowledgable; described in detail the histories and intricacies of the settings and added a great deal of personal history about the palace's occupants. Catherine Palace is quite stunning; glistening gold interiors and mirrors. Pavlovsk Palace is more refined and filled with beautiful works of art. You miss out on the gardens in winter but gain in no hordes of people. There is also an excellent gift shop nearby where you can purchase high quality, Russian handicrafts. The tour was booked through Viator...highly recommended! Also, Thank you to Irina; excellent guide!

Not to be missed - a spectacular display of the opulence of the Romanovs. We arrived early in the morning at opening time, only stopped for a quick snack at lunchtime and could have easily spent another day exploring the grounds and related mini palaces etc. A very enjoyable day. We took metro then local bus to the Palace and then walked into Pushkin and caught bus back to St Petersburg and metro back to hotel.

Long lines for the restored palace. Be prepared to wait on the long lines even in the low season of winter. The palace was burned down so it is completely renovated and restored,including the famous amber room. The palace has different ticket prices for students so bring your student ID if you're a student. The palace goes clock wise and a tour guide or guard will clap at you to correct your ealing path of you stay or go backwards.

Beautiful palace!. Beautiful palace, full of amazing decor and pieces full of historical meaning. Magnificent artwork from floor to the ceiling, every inch is amazing! The Amber Room, just recently recreated in its full magnificence is a special place, must-see at least once in a life time!

Sadly, Overrated.. Had high expectations for this palace and was sadly disappointed. My least favorite of the six imperial palaces visited. We had a first rate private tour guide. The history is magnificent, and yes the place is impressive at first glance… but don’t look too closely. Built by Peter the Great’s wife Catherine, made grander by their daughter Empress Elizabeth, and then Catherine the Great, and so on… I get that the property was damaged during WWII and greatly restored… as were many properties. Catherine’s Palace was probably beautifully restored at one time, but it would seem that limited monies are spent on maintaining the property or housekeeping. As one of the more visited properties in the St. Petersburg area, it seems like tourist monies are not reinvested back into this incredible landmark IMHO.

stunningly beautiful inside and out. We travelled to st petersburg by cruise ship and did 2 day sightseeing tour of the city... catherine palace was a stunning place to visit both inside tour and in the grounds... people very friendly with a wealth of knowledge...

Incredible. We did a private guided tour around the Catherine Palace. Well worth it! Our guide was able to give us fantastic insight into the palace, it's history and it's inhabitants - as well as telling us how you can rent out the grand hall for special occasions!! New life goal there I think.The Palace is everything you expect it to be, with floor to ceiling gold and intricate decor. The Amber Room is also one-of-a-kind which is still surrounded in mystery. A must see when in St Petersburg.We also got to stop at the Church near Pushkin that the Romanov family had built. This was very special (and empty), as well as the derelict armory and stables which have yet to make the renovation process of the Catherine Palace. All very extraordinary.

Ornate and Timeless. Just a short distance from St. Petersburg in the town of Pushkin lies this ornate blue,white and gold palace built as a summer residence for Catherine the Great. The gardens are neatly manicured and the golden hues of autumn added even more allure! It's a palace one must not miss! Looking at the photos I took, I still can't help but marvel at its enormity, its splendor and the history attached to it.

Exquisitely Elegant and Beautiful!. Jaw dropping. Every room is just luxury on top of luxury. The park is beautiful in the winter with all the white snow. It is very nice to walk around in and free during the winter time! There is a cafe located in a building in the park that looks very nice. But I did not get a chance to go. Would love to return in the summer.
Still amazing. Went in September and the weather was great. flowers still about and do walk the grounds they are great.

Grand and awesome. Located a short drive outside of St Petersburg, Catherine's Palace in the town of Pushkin is well worth a visit. Behind the majestic iron and gold gates you will find the blue facade of the massive palace. The advantage of a winter visit is the lack of crowds. As we toured the rooms we were occasionally by ourselves and had plenty of time to gaze in awe at the detailed beauty of the rooms and decor. You could almost envision a ball in the ballroom and feasts in the other rooms. The amber Room is splendid and the restoration throughout beautifully done. We were able to walk the outdoor trails and get a sense of the beauty of the park in warmer seasons. So much history to learn, wonderful to see it firsthand.
Palace and park - a real treat. I visited the Catherine palace and park and highly recommend it. It is an historic example of st. Petersburgs beauty. It will not disappoint.

Magnificent. My visit in February meant fewer visitors so we had the place to ourselves. Some renovations are still going on but the majority of the state rooms are looking spectacular.
Didn't get to walk around the park due to the snow.

Good to see the Park. Thr Palace was very interesting and I liked the park verymuch. It was a very interesting introduction into Russian gardening. I also liked the Hermitage pavillion. Really recomend to visit it!
just awesome. Better to go in summer because of snow you cant reach real beauty of the garden and palace . it is the shooting place of the indian movie named players (spider's villa)

Gorgeous!. This palace is one of my absolute favorites that I have visited in the world. Both the inside and outside of the palace are beautiful and definitely worth traveling outside the city to see.

Really impressive, almost makes Versailles look ordinary at times.... I refer to the mirrored and gilded main ballroom- gob-smacking! The amber room isn't shabby either....(visit the amber workshop if you have time- appointment in advance required and can be made on their website).
Loved Catherine's Palace. great visiting in February to avoid crowds of summer but if you do that you miss out on the grounds which are covered with snow
Fascinating. A beautiful palace, very easy to imagine the grand functions taking place here. The grounds are very elegant. Well worth the visit.

Amazing castle, difficult to get there. We decided to go on an adventure and take the train from Vitebsky station. First lesson: ticket counter for this line is near platform 3. Once on the train it felt like we're back on the soviet 80s and once at Tserskvoie station we took a bus to the palace. All in all it's difficult but doable if you don't speak Russian, like us. The castle itself is amazing and even during winter very well worth visiting. Don't skip the park either!

Another wonderful place!. We were spoilt for choice with all the fantastic places that there are to visit in St. Peterburg and the Catherine Palace was probably up there at the top, alongside the Winter Palace/Hermitage Museum. The rooms were grand and there were a lot of historical information and photos on the Romanovs. The Amber Room was not as spectacular as we had imagined though.
Absolutely beautiful. The state room and the Amber Room are worth the entrance fee alone. The park will be great in the Summer

Beautiful palace. We were lucky to go in the winter as we were told that the summer is horrendously busy. Due to the very few people we were able to see the full impact of the incredible gilded rooms and the Amber room. Don't miss this one. Go with a guide to get the best out of this.

Large Grounds. As with other palaces in St Petersberg full of artwork and china etc with elaborate room design. Highlight here is the Amber Room which is quite stunning. On a dry day very pleasant to walk around the large grounds with fountains.
Vast gardens & palace ground. Tranquil & away from the usual tourist crowd. Gardens are needly arranged & the compund kept clean. You'll need a good pair of walking shoes to explore.

The Elegance of Catherine's Palace. The front entrance with two stories of Greek columns and statues bears a strong resemblance to the “Library of Celsus” in ancient Ephesus, Turkey.2 The scene in episode 2 of the miniseries “War and Peace” that is constantly played in the Lifetime commercials is the New Year’s Eve Ball in “The Great Hall. Anna Rostova (actress Lily James) first dances with Prince Andrei Bolkonsky (actor James Norton) in the mirror lined, glittering hall with a vast ceiling painting. That scene made the movie. It was not the actors who created it. It was Catherine the Great’s taste in creating a “Bright Gallery”, the largest state room in palace.

Russian Culture at its Best. Fabulous place to see. Catherine the Great aquired art, furniture, and fittings from all over Europe and the place is truly spectacular. It has been restored to it former grandeur by the Russian Government. Keep in mind this tour, like all others requires a fair amount of walking. Not difficult walking but, typical of many tourist attractions here, the tour busses don't always get that close and the private tours which are usually better than the tour busses, are even further away. Most tours are for about an hour to hour and a half, which is enough time to see it unless you are doing some research, in which case you would probably be on your own.

Splendid both inside & out!. What a beautiful place to visit, fantastic palace to view from the outside and the most amazing interior! We visited in January when there was plenty of snow on the ground and although cold, it just added to the beauty of this place. The grounds are well kept and are also well worth taking extra time to stroll around.

Stunning restoration . It has been a pleasure to see the craftsmanship that went into restoring the beauty of this building It is very worth the tour as the majority of the building has been built to wow anyone who visits We wandered the gardens in full snow and still enjoyed the experience It is about an hour drive from the city and very near the airport. We did the tour on our last day and got dropped off to the airport straight afterAlso across from the entry is a few really nice gift shops and jewellery stores in the tower check them out

In few words the Great Palace and Park. Stay a few hours or all day. It is always a great place to spend time and one can come back again and again. So lovely and full of history. Very clean and pleasant.
Beautiful palace in winter. I find beauty in every room of the palace. The Amber Room was beautiful and stunning. Part of the garden and the pool becomes ice. So bleak.

summer is the time to plan a tour. I have been here tvvice but many years ago vvhen vvas a child. Here is impossible to check longer than one year ago.BUT. It vvas one of the best memories of my visits to Russia (I have been more than 20 times).

Stunning and Breathtaking!. A must see if in St. Petersburg! Worth the short trip by tour bus or car to see this amazingly restored Czar palace. The grounds are meticulously clean, the formal gardens beautiful and the opulent interiors unsurpassed. There is nothing else in the world that can compare with this grandeur, except for maybe another Russian palace, Peterhoff. Also, a must see!

Wow!. Went on a guided tour here, absolutely loved it, it was a crisp sunny day with snow on the ground and the palace looked magical. Fabulous opulent interiors , each room with a story to tell. Rooms flowed from each other so easy to navigate and felt quite intimate and easy to navigate unlike the hermitage which was so vast it was bewildering. A must see .

A real treat forty minutes from St. Petersburg. We were given a personal guided trip to this wonderful palace as a Christmas present, and what a treat.The guide, Anastasia, a delightful companion, gave us a wonderful tour round this magnificent palace with its intriguing history and shared many stories and anecdotes. We felt we got a real insight into the lives of those who created and often transformed this magnifently opulent historical masterpiece.She also helped negotiate the huge queue.A fabulous experience; well worth taking a guide if you can.
Just go!. You will be blown away by the splendour and opulence of this place. All the more so when you realise how much restoration work had to be done after WWII.

Flashy Lifestyle. The wealth of the Czars comes into true perspective at this palace. The way they lived, dined, and rested. The amber room is a must see! I got caught taking a picture of it. Oops! Luckily I wasn't asked to leave, but there are well-aged women on the lookout for people like you and me. The furniture, the artistry, the lifestyle is well worth your time. Again, it is 45 minutes to an hour long drive from the heart of Saint Petersburg, and you have to keep moving along to help accommodate all the other tourists. The structure is fabulous and modern re-arranging / decor of the Palace just brilliant.

Transport yourself back to 17C Russia A real treat.. Our timing of a visit to this popular Palace was unfortunate for although we had picked mid winter to visit St Petrsburg to avoid the bulk of the tourists we did fall on a Russian Holiday break!! The palace was therefore busier than a usual for an out of season visit BUT still with a little care and guided movement around we were able to have a magnificent trip back into the past.The conservation work on this palace is spectacular WELL done Russia Although some people might say it is over restored the fact that this magnificent building has been put back into good order is a credit to all involved.The gold leaf is outstanding as well as the floors and paintings The Catherine The Greats wing was all under wraps for restoration but the Baroque wings of the Palace were all on show.Try to get there first thing or late afternoon to avoid the main rush of midday tour buses A guide pre booked from St Petresburg would be a great investment as you need to get transport there and if visiting other palaces in the area that day then this becomes good value.Also he/she will know which queues to jump and the best routes to take to miss the crowdsUnfortunately due to the low temperatures outside the bground only got a fleeting visit from us but the midwinter scenes were wonderful and the palace was outstanding.Avioid the shops,a little tacky ,and the cafe was not the best.Not to be missed though,even if the amber room was all a replacement!!! No cameras allowed in this room although all the rest of the palace is very "Kodak friendly"

Strongly recommended. Tsarskoe Selo or Pushkin is 25 km from St Petersburg. We made an arrangement with a taxi driver to take us there and back and to wait 3 hours for 5000 Rubles (each additional hour 500 Rubles). Catherine Palace itself is very interesting and definitely well worth a visit. The gardens are vast and incredibly beautiful. It was -20 degrees when we were there and despite the cold it was a magical atmosphere, everything covered in snow, the trees shining like silver in the sun, truly peaceful in a beautiful setting. Next to Catherine Palace is Alexander Palace (the main residence of the last tsar and his family), much smaller but also set in beautiful gardens. Unfortunately it was closed at this time of year. Even if you have a few days in St Petersburg I think it is well worth setting aside a day to visit Tsarskoe Selo.

Just amazing. Each room is spectacular- ceilings, walls and even the floors! The Amber Room is breathtaking. The outside sets up the visit with the its scale and colour as well as the grounds. Worth the trip out of the city.

Worth the 45 minute drive out of St. Petersburg. We booked a day tour through viator.com and we did not regret it. Drove out through St. Petersburg and off to Pushkin we went. There our guide was able to get us in and get our coats in the very busy cloak rooms. Once in this Palace is just amazing. The amber room alone is worth the price of admission. If you have time and weather permits, make sure to walk the large gardens.

Beware the queue. This palace is very interesting and is adjacent to a beautiful park. It is stunning in the winter with all of the snow around. But beware of the queue and of the fact that they only let in people in intervals of 15 minutes. I stood in freezing cold for 2 hours before I got in. If there's more than one of you, then one person should keep the spot in the line and the other can wander around. Beware of the queue though. Queueing is not the Russians' strong suit, so be aware there'd be a crush when the line moves forward.

Simply stunning interior. This is also a must see, the amber room is fab! You cannot miss it, not to mention the beautiful interior and renovated masterpiece that this Palace is. Did ts with a guide which was most helpful in interpreting the symbolism of the paintings so one can start seeing the story they tell for yourself.

Amazing visit - well organised venue - abundant history!!. We visited the Catherine Palace by using a taxi and self toured with the audio guide. This worked really well for us and the cheapest most flexible option.The Palace is beautiful, inside and outside, with its well manicured lawns, gorgeous blue facade and grand entrance through golden gates.Inside, you are shepherded through the rooms with no room to deviate, but this means you see all rooms in their glory and the jewel in the crown, the Amber room.Make an appointment in advance and go to the Amber workshop within the grounds for a personalised tour of where they work on the Amber, the rich history of the Amber itself and of the fate of the Amber room and the painstaking reconstruction, for me if was the best part!!

Fabulous. A must see! You can lament the incredible indulgence by the Russian royalty at the expense of the peasants, but we were admittedly in awe of the art, the craftsmanship and the visionary masterpieces. Do not miss this.

History Lovers will enjoy!. Is not just a beautiful building but also interesting to see how the russian autocracy used to live. Furniture and personal belongings are well preserved and what was destroyed by the second world war is well reconstructed showing on photos the original and how was after the war.

My Guide Was Excellent. The hotel arranged a private car and guide for me. The guide had thirty-five years experience. She said I hit the jack-pot weather-wise, and there are almost no lines this time of year. The place is spectacular, but largely recreated.

Low season, best time to visit. A bit cold today with sunny blue skies and few visitors. Hardly anyone around so had full access to most of the rooms. Get a guided tour to take advantage of the vast history associated with the palace. Walk the full grounds to appreciate the lake, hermitage and bathhouses.
Nice visit. On the one hand the ornate rooms and displays are captivating. On the other hand, some of the rooms are not well curated or decorated. Just rooms with old furniture.
Well worth it. Suggest you don't go in the busy period, My to September. In June we were informed they have 10k visitors per day. Spectacular amber room, not to be missed.

Absolutely stunning. The gold covered outside of the palace, the ambar room, the ball room, the gardens, the history, everything is magnificent in this palace. It's amongst my top three palaces in the world. Highly recommend!

A little too much gold but beautiful grounds. Catherine's palace is definitely worth a visit, and helps break up the drive to Peterhof if you are headed there. However, I thought it was a little monotonous. Every room is covered in gold leaf and mirrors. They look pretty similar. The grounds and various buildings are beautiful and walking around in nice weather is lovely.

Amazing opulence. Absolutely stunning opulence and once again the benefit of having a guide cannot be overstated. December a good time to visit to avoid the crowds but even then you have wait at times for the larger groups in front of you. The park makes for a pleasant stroll
this puts all other royal palaces in shadow. Virtually the most exclusive interior ever. Have you heard of the amber room? It's real! But it is only one out of hundred of amazing decor rooms
Lovely and very well preserved. This is such a beautifull and well preserved example of a palace. It really gives you a feel for the royal life 2 centuries ago. If you have the time, visit it!

Gorgeous! Amazingly restored! Magestic Palace. We visited St Petersburg as part of a cruise of the Baltic countries and Russia. It was by far our favorite city. Catherine's palace in Pushkin was superb - you must see the before and after restoration pictures to understand how skillful and passionate those Russian artists were in restoring the place to even better than it originally looked. Palace itself was more impressive than the park. Try to be there early to beat the crowds going in. Long walks are expected I guess but you could carry a bottle with you.

Spectacularly opulent summer palace of the royal family. The summer palace is about 45 minutes drive from the downtown city precinct and it's best to get there just on opening time (10am in winter) before the crowds of tourists start to arrive. Even though it was low season on the date we visited, there were large tour groups starting to crowd the rooms so it could be bedlam in spring and summer.The palace is very long but not particularly wide, with a corridor running the length on either side, and opening alternatively into single rooms, and then a series of grand ballrooms.The palace was badly damaged during WW2 and the restoration work has been done to a very high standard such that it is very difficult to detect the replacement from the original.Get a guide to obtain the best from your visit as the history behind the palace, it's rooms and inhabitants over the centuries is fascinating.The grand ballroom alone has 11kg of gold leaf applied to the columns and relief decorations.The gardens are basically closed during winter although you are free to wander the grounds. The majority of the thousands of marble ornaments in the gardens are boxed in situ to protect them from the winter ravages.Don't miss this during a visit to St Petersburg

Breathtaking!. If you go to St Petersburgh, don't miss this place! Unforgettable and beautiful. Also its very easy to go there from Downton. You shouldtake the subway. Take the subway until the metro station Moskovskaya (blue line). Then a bus in front of House of Soviets (numbers 549/ 387/545). The bus will take you to the palace. And to go back is the same thing. Close to the palace, 10 minutes by walking, there is a nice square with a beautiful small church, with gold roof, very typical russian architecture. There are some nice restaurants there and also cheap and nice places to eat, like the Kitchen coffee. From there you can also get the bus to go back.

Amazing building with rooms that will take your breath away. We visited the summer palace on a recent cruise after seeing the winter palace the day before. The outside of the palace was breathtaking enough and the drizzle of rain didn't stop the small band that greeted us from playing. Inside was worth the 10 minute wait outside in the queue. The Amber room was particularly beautiful. Well worth a visit.

lovely day. This is another beautiful place. We did make the mistake of getting there way too early. You have to do your homework and understand when these places are open to the Russian public, and when they are open for visitors. We ended up with hours to walk around the surrounding gardens and town before we could get inside the 'gates'. Once in it was very nice. The Palace tour was a little crowded, but not overwhelming so, and once you got through the first part, the crowd thinned out and it was very pleasant. The gardens were very nice and i guess a great place for wedding photos as I think we saw 3 or 4 brides! Getting there was a bit of a challenge, taking the metro to the end of a line, then finding the bus to take us the rest of the way, but worth the trip for sure!

A reminder of former elegance and power. After a short coach ride from the port, you wind your way through the streets and through a gateway and there you are greeted by the splendour of Catherines Palace. Brightly coloured, opulent and impressive in scale, the palace is a must see on any visit to St Petersburg. Originally built at the height of power and fully restored to its spectacular best. If you travel, as I do, to see impressive sights and have special days out, then a wander through the mirrored and gilded rooms and corridors will certainly give full value. The amber room is worth the entrance fee alone. After your eyes have been sparkled and swirled the calm simple but delightful gardens are a blessing. Walk where the rich and powerful once walked and reflect on all that you have seen.

Wow!. Nothing can quite describe Catherine's Palace. You just have to go and see it for yourself. The Amber Room is breathtaking but the whole palace is at a level of opulence you wouldn't believe. Amazing.

Amazing place to visit - especially in Summer. On our recent visit to SPB we just had to visit the palace and gardens. It's absolutely amazing. We took a tour bus from downtown SPB to the palace, so it was convenient to get there and back. The tour was in Russian, so it's better if you understand Russian, but they also offer tours in other languages or you can drive directly to the palace. The palace and gardens are just amazing. Even though there were a lot of people (especially inside), you still got a good look at the impressive art and luxury of those times. Especially, also considering that most of the art had to be significantly restored after it got damaged/destroyed or buried during the war. We took one afternoon, but I am sure you can easily spend a whole day there.

Russian grandeur. This attraction was part of our tour itinerary and it was worth the visit. Unfortunately it was late September hence most of the fountains were drained off and closed. Nonetheless the palace interior and the various exhibits were very amazing and breathtaking. To really understand and appreciate this historical site its best that you go with a tour guide. Again be prepared for a lot of walking and toilet break can be challenging.

The Summer Palace. Every room in this palace is more exquisite than the last. It is about 25 miles outside of St. Petersburg, and well worth the trip. We had a wonderful, well-informed tour guide, and she had many details to share as we walked through this extraordinary building. One rarely sees this kind of opulence, and it is breathtaking. If you have limited mobility, this may not be the tour for you, as viewing this palace requires extensive walking, and there is absolutely no place to sit and rest. However, the grounds, and the palace interiors, are well worth seeing.

A good visit en-route to the airport. We visited the Palace 'en route' (sort of) to the airport on our last day in St. P before catching a BA flight departing at 17:00. This worked very well - we had time for a non-rushed visit to the Palace by taxi (definitely worth doing even if you have a short time in St. P), time for a relaxed lunch in the Books and Bards(?) cafe, and then our driver took us on to the airport where we arrived at about 3pm. This was efficient use of time. The Palace is beautiful - however the crowds at the entrance and using the cloakroom to hang up coats can be large and frustrating. Maybe best to get a guide and skip the lines.

A Most See Attraction. The history in Catherine Palace and Park is staggering. I learned more in a morning tour than I had know in the past. The gardens are beautiful and they alone are worth the price of admission. The Palace is spectacular with all the furnishings and stories that a guide provides. A Most See if you are in St. Petersburg.

Amazing example of what an unlimited budget can achieve, or you're a Tsar!. Being in Saint Petersburg for a few days is a once in a lifetime event for most people, so when one does get to there, make the most of it! A guided tour of Catherine Palace with transport by coach is a whole day's trip.The castle has been torn down and rebuilt 6 times, each time on a mind blowing grander scale. It was last destroyed by retreating German soldiers near the end of World war 2 (there is a small photographic exhibition of that event in one of the passages).The palace gets many hundreds of visitors each day, so the tours are run with military style precision. Entry is via an ornately decorated wrought iron gate, you are placed in groups with your guide and proceed up the steps into the palace, via a turnstile. Then the "wow" begins! Enjoy the photos!
Catherines palace. Brilliant venue and excellent tour. Get here early to avoid the crowds. Wonderfull gardens. Good place to take the hydrofoil from back to St Petersburg

Worth the journey - amazing. Of course it is over the top - it was meant to impress. Very reminiscent of Versailles. So much gilding and so many mirrors but absolutely beautiful dining areas and the inlaid floors are magnificent.

Beautiful Palace. It's an interesting experience to walk through this palace with its many golden rooms. Each room tells a story of the inhabitants of the royalty of the palace that once resided there. May be boring for little children and not advisable because there's plenty of things one shouldn't touch.
Spend a leisurely day strolling the gardens and savoring the palace.. We spent a sunny day there, meandering through the gardens, touring the palace, enjoying the day. Fantastic.

Dazzling. The palace interior really dazzles - I've never seen so much gold. It's very beautiful, and the size can be appreciated by looking through a doorway and seeing the seemingly endless doorways stretching a very long way. After several golden rooms it was pleasant to see a few with paintings. In the famous Amber room, photos aren't supposed to be taken, and the guide didn't seem to know the reason for this. However, as she pointed out, there's no reason why they can't be taken from the doorway. Because of this, these areas were quite crowded. The grounds are pretty, and a walk round them affords a good view of the palace exterior.

Beautiful palace!. We visited Catherine Palace while on a cruise. We were forced into a tour because we did not realize that we needed a Visa to enter Russia (unfortunate miscommunication?? and lack of obvious follow through on our part). The tour did not disappoint and the palace was one of the definite highlights. Because it was summer and it is a popular cruise spot, the palace does get very crowded. Catherine certainly wanted to upstage any other royal. If you are not booking through a tour company, make sure to get a Visa!!
Well worth the trip- Over the top.. In an effort to out do the French in gaudy, the Russian Queen does full blast. Leave a lot of time and hope for a nice stay. Great art collection.
Beatiful. you cabn visit this beatiful park all year around but it is especially beatiful in summer and autumn.

lovely day. i spent the day walking around the grounds with a dear friend, unfortunately I picked the day it was closed to visitors, I will go back and see it from the inside, we picked a beautiful day so didn't feel like I missed anything.
nice palace!!!!. You should go early time. I went to there at 8 am, however viewing time is very limited and I went outside after 1 hour, already it was very long que...

Amazing experience. We did a two day - highlights of St Petersburg tour which included a visit to this opulent palace, There were three other cruise ships in St Petersburg at the same time as us - consequently everywhere we queued. Catherine Palace was no exception. That said I would not have missed it! It reminds me of Versailles - with bells on as it is far more ornate.

Amazing, opulent palace with interesting history. Totally stunning attraction which has an equally interesting history. Make sure you booked a guide and be patient as it is very popular but well worth it.

A feast for art lover's eyes. Originally built in 1717 by Catherine I, it changed various architects until 1756 when architect Bartolomeo Rastrelli showed all his talent creating the 325 m. long new Palace, using 100 kgs of gold for its decoration. The edifice was pulled down 6 times and built again until Catherine the Great called the Scottish architect Charles Cameron who turned many rooms to Neoclassical style.The Palace was completely destroyed by the Nazis during WWII. Fortunately some Soviet archivists had copied most of the interior and the reconstruction was based on their documents. The marble staircase (1860 by Hippolyto Monighetti) impresses the visitor with its rocaille style. The Great Hall is part of the Golden Enfilade rooms. It amazes everyone with its 860 sq.m., the various windows with mirrors and the exceptional decoration carved by 130 masters. On the ceiling the Triumph of Russia by Giouseppe Valeriani in 1753.The Amber Room is the Palace's highlight. No words can describe the colours and the details of this masterpiece. It's an exact copy of the original that disappeared under mysterious circumstances. The restoration lasted 24 years and 5.7 tonnes of raw material were used by expert Russian stone-cutters. We were very lucky to enjoy its uniqueness for 15 minutes and take photos too, in the evening, when the Palace is closed for the public. I mention this because visitors during the day opening times, are forced to walk very quickly in the Amber Room without being able to enjoy anything and without taking any photos. So, please try to find the best way for you to visit this unbelievable jewel. We enjoyed also a reception and ballet in the garden and period dancing in the Grand Hall. Unforgettable evening that ended in the restaurant with a great dinner, folklore songs and balalaika and accordéon music.

Incredible Palace!. WOW- of course these royals had a ton of money. So they lived a life of luxury. Best done with a tour guide- it is crowded too- and the crowds can be frustrating with the picture taking. But get a guide and they can navigate you through the highlights of this palace and the grounds. A bit out of Saint Petersburg so you need to arrange transportation.

Impressive. Totally one of the best places I've visited. The palace itself is a piece of art, interior and exterior and the gardens are also beautiful, even though I was there in late October so they'll probably look better during spring time. It really leaves you in awe, how a place like this exists, words cannot describe it.
Another fabulous place. Beautiful interior, outside no hell at this time of year. Come with an organized tour group to get the most out of it, also groups seem to get entry preference.
Wonderland.. We arrived on a warm sunny day which enabled us to walk through the gardens with their magnificent fountains and unbelievably ornate statues. Another "must see".
Beautiful, even in autumn. Wonderful day in Palace and Park. Quite informative audio guides. Beautiful place to spend all day overall.
A must see. This was certainly an impressive and opulent place where you can learn so ,Chu. The gardens and equally impressive and tranquil at the same time

Beautiful Palace. It was so great that I have visited this Palace. The Palace has been upkept in very nice condition and very beautiful inside. Taking photos are allowed in this Palace (other Palaces may not)!

Beautiful. It is well worth the hour long drive from St. Petersburg to see this amazing palace which is perche don the crest of a hill.The outside is stunning, azure facade with snow white columns and guilded ornaments and the gold onion shaped domes on the turrets is overwhelming and prepares you for the inside tour of more opulence and splendour which begins at the white marble staircase.The great hall / throne room is huge and you can easily imagine the balls held here in the past. The tour continues through many of the restored rooms, many set out ready for dining. Ther Amber room is a work of art and it is hard to comprehend the value of all the amber stuck to the walls in mosaics , picture frames etc. all set off with more gold !!! A beautiful summer residnce.
Day at the Palace. We had a personal guide which made the visit so much more interesting. A remarkable place to visit and the restoration work has been colossal following fire damage.

Tsarskoye Selo. Tsarskoye Selo is the original name of the Palace built from 1752 to 1756. A beautiful blue colour. We traveled form St Petersburg by bas with took at least 1 hour 1/2 to get there. Our tour guide Julia was an art history major and knew her stuff. This Palace has been destroyed during the war, however they have done an extremely great job of reproducing the rooms. Not all of the 69 rooms have been refurbished as the cost is go great. The staircase we went up when we got inside was plastered and had Chinese porcelain on display. I loved the ballroom, it had so much gold work around the windows, doors, mirror and ceiling it just sparkled. The most expensive room in the Palace is the famous Amber room. The whole room is make of different colours of Amber and there is absolutely no picture taking. The craftsmen to rebuild the room had to come from Germany as they original was lost during WWII. We didn't see the gardens which are extensive as it was pouring with rain. It is so beautiful a place that it was a dream come true to see this place. So worth the money.

Oppulence. Yet again huge halls decked in gold, rooms with gold , priceless treasures. The grounds are as incredible. a huge lake with a concert hall in the middle , sculpted gardens with hidden buildings for entertaining in private. A hidden world

Very beautiful palace. We took from the "moscovskaya" a mini-bus to "pushkin" (the village where the palace is located in) and after a 35-40 min drive we got there.
A very nice palace with many beautyful & special rooms to see + a very nice gardens with different buildings to see. We recommend.

Not only a palace, but a park. This is a palace where you have to see the park to complete the experience. The palace is so grand. Inside you will find both baroque and classical style of interior design. There is one room that is so golden that you feel almost blind from the glare lol ...The park is equally beautiful and BIG. I visited during autumn so I enjoy the green, yellow and red leaves through out. Wear good walking shoes if you plan to visit it. And keep yourself warm - the wind can be quite strong in some part of the park.Food: the palace has a cafe. Food is of at standard quality but price is more expensive than outside.

Its so big and beautiful. More than the palace take a stroll around and fell it.. Its by far the biggest residence I have visited. more than the palace, the park was lovely. I spent about 6 hours in this place. Out of this, 2 hours in a que just to enter the Palace. The view from anywhere inside is out of a movie scene. I would love to visit again.
Must see. The palace and the park are extremely beautiful and it is one of the places to visit when in St. Petersburg. Amber chamber is a bonus

Just Awesome. From the title you cab tell that we found this place awesome. its just a beautiful setting and the fountains with the music just make it magical. Need to have the ability to walk a fair distance to enjoy this place at its best.

Beautiful. This palace was spectacular, both inside and out. The grounds are wonderful, and the beauty of the palace is indescribable. We were with a tour group, and were taken by tour bus. It is in a suburb of St. Petersburg.
Catherine's Palace. Wonderful, But wish we had more time. There is so much to see.Do some background research and understand the period in history.

catherine the great's intimate retreat+. similar to the hermitage the palace is covered in gold typical of the baroque period.. catherine and i have a very different idea of intimate.it is huge. one of the main features is the amber room. the wealth and warmth of the amber encompasses every tone from lemon yellow to dusky topaz. even the caskets and ornaments r amber.from 1763 on catherine spent spring and summer here dividing her time between affairs of states and amusements. u firstenter the enormous golden ballroom looking bigger than its 846 square meters because of the mirrored walls and the spectacular painted ceiling. it feels lightandairy.there r dining rooms galore as u pass thru one in a blue theme w. white trim making the first diningroom look like wedgewood platter. then u pass thrue a smaller dinging room in shades of spring flowers against green walls. then a beige autumn=toned room. each dining room would feed 100 diplomats as catherine held court.there is a small chaple (small by russian standards) in the wast wing called the church of the ressurection. and two wings of living quarters that r restful w/ the lack of gold, but still huge. the palce isset in a 100 hectare park be prepared to walk for 1 - 2 hours/ there r a unique ensamble of monuments incl. chesma column,the column ofmorea, the kagil obelisk and the crimean column commemorating the russian victory over the turks.. .there r an abundance of bldg. even tho u can't go inside the bldg, r set around water features encouraging catherinee's guests to socialize. as they wander the sculpted areas of trees, plants flowers accented by sculptures, pools and architecture. allow an hour for the palace and two for the gardens.

Really Nice Castle Grounds. if you are in St. Petersburg, you have to visit St. Catherine's Palace!The structures of the palace are just magnificent and the exhibits are very well taken care of. There is also a room called as the "Amber room" in which you can't take a picture of it, it was destroyed once but they managed to rebuilt it.If you love royal and exquisite designs you will definitely love the palace tiles, wallpapers, and fabric designs. The designs are mixtures of victorian and baroque. Do not miss the enormous Peacock Coo coo clock inside the palace!If you have enough time, do visit the garden; they are very beautiful!

Take enough time to enjoy the park after seeing the Palace. This place is filled with history and beauty and it would be hard to pick a favorite part. Make sure you see the Amber room, and the Grand Ballroom, but take time to enjoy the outside areas that are just as beautiful with the fountains and flowers.

Another amazaing site - Add this to your list for sure!. A guide or audio tour is a must as there is much to see and learn about this history and how this came to be - the craftsmen and tradesmen who built it were simply amazing. There is a lot of Tzar-ist history with this property, and it is simply breath-taking inside and out.
Superb example of brilliant work. Restoration of the most amazing pleasure palace after major destruction in Second World War. A picture of tsarist luxury.

Make the effort. Like Versailles but much more bling. Gardens are wonderful and the Amber Room is a must see although after all the white and gold it is a bit underwhelming. Take a taxi - they are cheap and public transport out here is complex. We found taxis waiting when we left

Opulence to the max!. It is a stunning place rich in history and everything else. Very much worth the time to visit and enjoy. Make sure your have a good guide. Ours was fantastic and although I'd been there before he made it seem all new!
A treat for the eyes for sure.

Czarist Opulence. Anyone visiting St. Petersburg for even a few days should seriously consider making the 20 mile side trip to Pushkin to visit Catherine Palace and its grounds. The palace and grounds are spectacular and arguably rival those of France's Palace of Versailles. In addition, the palace is a kind of historical testament to 18th century czarist extravagance and the "income inequality" that existed in Russia in that age. It is important to remember that the original palace was destroyed by the German army in World War II, so tourists see a recreation built by the Russian government. The rebuilt palace includes a copy of the original palace's "Amber Room," which is seemingly unique among European palaces, and which by itself makes the trip to Catherine Palace worth it. The palace also features wonderful parquet wood floors, and the caretakers of the palace require visitors to don plastic shoe covers to visit the palace's interior, something for which a visitor should be prepared.

Well worth a visit. They're working hard on renovating the Catherine Palace after it was devastated during WWII and it's looking good! Gives you a good feel as to what Court life was like - the gardens are beautiful too. We went with an English speaking guide who gave detailed background on the history and the individual rooms, but you could equally enjoy a guide free visit and just soak up the atmosphere and opulence!

The highlight of our trip. We know that all of the renovations are recent. The Palace is a huge draw, but the recovery from the WWII devastation is at least as important. This is probably the finest look of all of the St. Petersburg attractions. You've gotta do it!
Art Travel Trip. In Pushkin, a very nice village outside from St. Petersburg, 20 miles away another "must to see once in your life MTSOIYL :)" incredible architecture and decoration

Must see. I spent three days in St Petersburg as part of a cruise so it was very much a whistle-stop. Catherine's Palace is in a beautiful setting, take time to wander the gardens. The rooms are gorgeous but as with all the palaces, a couple of hours does not do them justice. We were the the only tour group there at 10am.

Ridiculous extravagance. Went with personal guide. Worth it if you can. This is a great palace on a fine day. Beautiful grounds for walking around and internal restoration after the damage of ww2 is opulent.

Beautiful Palace. visited here with a small group through SPB tours. a beautiful and very large palace, well maintained. our guide took us inside, and the interior is amazing. There is so much to see and photograph, lots of gold and crystal! The Amber Room is a must, totally amazing room. Would love to visit there again and spend more time.
Worth Visiting. Catherine Palace and Park is on the way back from Grand Palace Peterof to St Petersburg and is worth visiting. It is a grand layout of heritage buildings.

Amazing palace, beatiful ground. Should buy your entrance tickets in advance from internet to skip long ticket office queue. A visit to Catherine's Palace is an all-day affair. The Amber room is fascinating which has been completely restored after the damage caused by WWII. In the ball room a huge amount of gold has been used to gild the inner details and facade. The Palace garden is amazing, You can easily spend hours wandering in it. There is electrical car tours so you can easily see most part of place in 50-60 minutes.

Russian Opulence. We were there in the autumn and the grounds were especially beautiful with the fall colors. This is a breathtaking display of Russian Tsar opulence. The amount of gold and wealth is staggering.
Gilt galore!. Never seen anything quite like this! A bit over the top of course, but still quite marvelous. Loved the amber room, not to be missed..

Just one of the lovely places that make you you fall in love with St Petersburg. This is a gorgeous palace that is beautifully preserved. All the beautiful colors and gold filigree make you want to photograph every inch

Defintely should be on your intinerary. Very beautifully reconstructed (the Nazis destroyed it during WWII) but it's still beautiful. Nice park around it for strolling. The inside is also beautiful but you can't take photos of the amber room. They want you to buy picture books instead from them.

A must see!. It's quite the palace. Room after room after room of extravagance. It must be nice to be the Queen.....I wouldn't want to have to clean the place. Housekeeping is probably constantly dusting.The restoration after the Nazi's trashed it is itself a work of art.
MUST VISIT!. Absolutely gorgeous. Memorized by the size and enormity of this palace. Inside is worth a tour as well.

Beautiful palace. I have been to the three palaces at Saint Petersburg - they are "winter palace", "summer palace" and Catherine's Palace. I would say this is the least liked palace to me, reasons being "winter palace" has a lot more precious paintings and treasures to see and "summer palace" can learn more about the queen than Catherine's palace. Liked the other two palaces, it uses the gold x white colour and mirrors and Morris, paintings and paintings to design each room of the palace. Catherine's also a beautiful palace and you shall pay a visit if you have time.

A great day at Pushkin and the Catherine Palace. We took a private tour booked through Viator. A great day with our guide Anastasia. The palace is superb and able to be photographed inside as well as the gardens....all except the amber room which cannot be photographed. Autumn is coming and the trees are looking beautiful.
Not to be missed. Breathtaking to see. The rooms in the palace are astounding, the grounds and gardens are beautiful. So much history captured here.

This takes the Hermitage to another level. Catherine the Great was a powerful woman and her taste was larger than life. The rooms in this palace are over the top! Beautiful Dutch-inspired Delft Bleu furnaces are the fanciest room heaters I've ever seen.

Beyond oppulent. When you see Catherine's Palace there is no doubt why the People revolted in 1917. It is so beautiful, and so golden, it shines on a beautiful day.Our guide was able to get us ahead of the normal tour groups, I highly recommend a private guide in St. Petersburg, they are not expensive, and there are thousands of tourists at most destinations.We visited the Amber Room, which wasn't really what I thought it would be, but the artisan work involved was exquisite. It's not bright and shiny, it's murals made of hundreds of different shades of amber.The state rooms and table settings make the English palaces of the same era look dingy.Peterhof too was amazing, but that's another review.

Astounding. We were on an organised tour and everything went smoothly, we didn't need to wait at all while I saw other people just arriving (without a tour) and they had very long queues to join. The Palace is very impressive and no words can describe the Amber Room! The grounds were just as incredible.

Another must-see site. The Palace is absolutely beautiful! So much gold and art and opulence. Be prepared for a considerable amount of walking and no place to top and sit for awhile. You must travel in groups. The park is immaculately landscaped and cared for. Beautiful fountains, statuary, and flowers. The are benches along the paths for resting if required.

Amazing palace and gardens.. Amazing palace and gardens. Over the top! Seeing all of the palaces with their glitz and gold, its a wonder that there wasn't an revolution earlier. The rooms seem to go on forever, each different and opulent. The gardens which were lovely in September and go on for acres. We only saw a small part of it. Its a very nice ride out there and we ate lunch at a nice rest restaurant in the town of Pushkin.

Beautiful. We got to the palace by bus, a long trip but it was worth it! we only visited the park (120 rub/pers) which was amazing with orange colored trees all over the place, and we took a horse ride for (200 rub/pers). you will definitely enjoy the visit (plenty of things and places to see so don't worry about getting bored)

Amazing & Beautiful. The best way to see St. Petersburg, is with a tour, we went with Dancing Bear Tours they were excellent !! Some of the many highlights were the Hermitage Museum, Catherine Palace & Peterhoff, there is so much to see, we loved it.

Amazing!. I you visit St. Petersburg, book the best tour you can of Catherine Palace so you can see as much as possible and spend time in the famous Amber Room. Our guide was very knowledgable and we were very much in awe of the art and history of this place. Before visiting, I read two books by Robert Massie, bios of both Peter the Great and Catherine the Great and I would recommend both to help you get a good understanding of the times in which they lived. We visited in September, so the weather was still very comfortable and we had no rain which made touring easy. Be sure you have comfortable walking shoes, and if you take a backpack, it will have to be checked, so we left ours on the bus and only brought essentials that fit in a small purse or jacket pockets.
Well worth visiting. Our visit was included with our Viking River Cruise. Beautifully restored. Interesting piece of history. Worth the trip there to visit.

A restored treasure. After seeing photos of this place as a bombed out shell from WW2, it's amazing to see the beautiful painstaking restoration of Catherine's Palace. Opulent is an understatement. The palace and gardens rival Versailles. A must-see when visiting St. Petersburg.

Riches beyond belief!. I was not expecting to see this kind of beauty in Russia. I knew there is money there, but this was far beyond what I ever imagined. The history grabbed my full attention. I wish I could have spent more time here. I felt like Cinderella.

Unforgetable. A majestic palace. The difficulties in the restoration work and the effective realization are a Russian pride. We enjoyed what we saw and felt. I recomend a visit and be prepared to hear and know a lot about the life and history of this place.

Great day trip. Beautiful Palace and gardens. It's amazing to think they only spent a month or two here during the whole year! Since Catherine was fond of chanting/ singing she built a little acoustically perfect room down by the water-- when we went there was a choral group there that would give little concerts during the day.
Russian Versailles.. The outside of the building is stunning, the gardens are beautiful, some of the fountains are unbelievable

A great day-trip. This was about an hour's journey out of town. Make note that if you use Google maps to plan your journey here, the bus number which gets you there from the metro has changed its number from 186 to 286 - the bus stop numbers haven't caught up yet either, so you are still looking out for both, when making your way home afterwards. This is a beautiful estate, not as glitzy and pompous as Petergof, which made me like it more, but that's just personal taste. The staff who work at the palace are also a lot more polite and helpful than at Petergoff, and we were thus advised on how to spend out time at the estate to our best advantage. We hired a guide upon our arrival for ten pounds - she did not speak English, but as a Russian speaker myself, I enjoyed her little tour, which lasted us until the time of palace admission. The palace tour takes 20 minutes, and you are lead around by a palace guide who uses a short-distance radio set to make sure everyone hears well. Important to note - headsets for foreigners cost an extra 150 roubles and have to be purchased at the cashier desk number 5 BEFORE you go through to the room where everyone else gets their headsets. Make sure you dedicate a full day to the palace, as the extensive grounds deserve a lot of time on their own. There are very tame red squirrels living on the estate, so if you bring some squirrel-friendly food with you on the trip, you can possible capture some great nature shots. A fairly inexpensive golf buggy (about 5 pounds) ride around the estate can ensure you cover more ground if you are short on time or can't walk for whatever reason), which means you will see various architectural and landscaping features of the park. As a foreigner, I would probably try and book a tour from the city as this would make travelling and information-gathering a lot easier.
Gorgeous Grounds & Architecture. Although we only spent 3 hours here, you could spend days getting to see all the gorgeous grounds & gardens & buildings now a state museum.
Stunning. What a fantastic job of restoration. Truly mind blowing palace. Unfortunately it was raining which didn't give us the best views of the gardens. Well worth a visit.

Pretty gardens. We travelled there by public bus, very simple. The Castle itself couldn't be visited because of an official visit but the gardens are pretty and we visited the Hermitage, the dining room of Catherine the Great for her friends with the tables and food that were trolleyed up and down so as not to be disturbed by the staff. Fascinating.

Luxury palace. We booked our ticket in advance. At first I was confused that I have to book time slot when I arrive there or I can get in anytime I want. So we can change tickets at 12.00-16.00 and we can enter to palace anytime we want between 12-16.00. When we get inside we have to get in line a little bit to enter and when we get inside we have to get in line again ( this line include everyone that booked ticket in advance or buy ticket that day or group tour) so about 30 mins in line and we are in. The palace is great, beautiful with lot of people.

Gorgeous palace and lovely park!. Beautiful museum with amazing interior and exterior, brilliant artifacts lots and lots to see. It a very rich place full of beautiful old monuments from different cultures. One day to see everything is not nearly long enough.
Opulence!!!. Fabulous ! Gold gilded rooms and a visit to the Qamber room high lights the lavish lifestyle enjoyed by so few at this time in Russia.
INCREADIBLE!. A gorgeous palace filled with history. I felt transported in time. It is worth the trip. A must see!

Catherine Palace. Our tour guide picked us up at the hotel and drove us out to the Catherine Palace. The palace is jaw dropping, the baroque decor and gold leaf are beautiful and the proportions of the rooms are perfect. The grounds are beautiful and although not as dramatic as Peterhof I found it a much more interesting and elegant Palace to visit.

Other summer palace than Peterhof. Catherine Palace, like Peterhof Palace, was a fabulous summer palace for Russia’s tsars. I visited Peterhof Palace about 5 years ago and very impressed with those beautiful fountains. Looking the exterior of Catherine Palace, it is about half a mile long, very difficult to capuche into one picture from one end to other. The luxurious interiors are something unique and different from Peterhof Palace. The Great Hall, as “Hall of Light” is gold everywhere, occupying the full width of the palace. The Amber Room was dismantled by German troops in 1941, and rebuilt through many years hard work based on black and white photographs. Portrait Hall is covered with fine printings to every inch of wall space. The garden is large; most visitors only walk through to the lake side, not go through each building around it. It was a great visit

Absolutely gorgeous in Autumn. We visited the park in mid-September and I must say -maybe it's one of the best time to do that. The weather was really nice, so it was such a pleasure to wander around, take pics, relax by the lake. A tip -take some sandwiches and a thermos with hot tea or coffee with you, sit at one of the benches by the lake and take a little break from the fuss of the city life enjoying the view and fresh air.

The Ultimate Show Palace.. The palace is splendid beyond belief and was the residence of Catherine the First and then rebuilt by her daughter Emress Elizabeth in 1756 who very much loved the Rococo style. The light, mirrors and furnishings are simply something to see and the beautiful porcelain stoves in many rooms are beautiful. Later Catherine the Great lived there and preferred a more subtle style and covered much of the decoration. It is the home of the fabled Amber Room where NO photos are permitted. During the war the Nazi destruction was devastating, but truly skilled and gifted restoration people did a magnificent job that is hard to believe when you see the photos of the damage done in World War II. The palace grounds and outbuildings are beautiful and a delight to see.

A must visit, not only for the Amber Room. Site of the famous Amber Room (where you are not allowed to take photos). But really every room and hall is spectacular. Be sure to take a walk in the park, down to the Bath House - lovely.

Unbelievably over the top. This is the Versailles of Russia, the amount of gold gilt is amazing and the ballroom is their version of the Hall of Mirrors at Versailles.This is a must see if you are going to St Petersburg.

Dont miss the Amber room. If you are lucky enough to visit St Petersburg, do not forget to visit the Catherine palace. Most of the tour is on the first floor and as its a long narrow building this means you have very little stairs to climb. This is very like the Palace of Versailles, with lots of red and gold. For anyone interested in interior design or just for the wow factor, its well worth a visit. I recommend not to miss the Amber Room which has been fully restored and only completed in 2003. The various shades of amber used to create the room is amazing. There are quite good reference books available in the shop at reasonable prices. The cost of other little souvenir items are very expensive though compared to regular shops. I would suggest you get these elsewhere. The ladies who are monitoring the rooms are quite stern and unapproachable but this does not impact too much on the visit. We had a registered guide with us and she still got told off for being too slow through the rooms. You must leave heavy jackets in the cloakroom and you are not allowed carry bottles of water. Once you know this in advance, you can dress accordingly as its quite warm inside.
Dream realized......... Did not disappoint a really awe inspiring place that you need plenty of time to take everything in. We arrived by boat and that was really magical...

very beautiful place. very nice place to go, although a little far from Petersburg (in Pushkin) but it deserves. It's almost like Versailles of Paris in size and luxury, also the gardens are vast and large.

remarkable recovery from damage during WW2. Goodness knows knows what the rebuild has cost however the Russians have painstakingly restored the palace after reckless damage during the war.The story behind the establishment of the palace and the subsequent collections is an amazing story and characteristically Russian thanks to that wonderful personage - Catherine the Great.Do not miss.

Two trips there..... On our stay in Saint Petersburg we actually visited Catherine's Palace twice and it gave us some insight here. The first was part of a bigger tour and the palace and grounds out in the suburbs are impressive. We went upstairs and visited 5-6 rooms plus the throne room . It was vacation time (July) and crowded . We spent 1/2 hour in the throne room waiting to exit in a crowded, hot room (with window air conditioning). Nice but not a great experience due to the crowd.But we visited the next night as part of a special tour "Evening with the Tsars" of about 60 people (guests) at a leisurely pace through the carriage Museum, 12 rooms-some with live music. We entered the throne room and picked up champagne and listened to a short concert. Then The "Tsar and Tsarina" came in after which a couple did two period dances. We then left and were greeted by a military band outside with a coach and horses bringing in 2 special guests who waltzed. After this we were lead to a restaurant on the grounds and had a very nice 4 course meal with Vodka and a Russian band playing all types of music with high energy and customer interaction. This was our top treat of the cruise, but expensive.Either way Catherine's palace is worth seeing but choose a cooler day or a non vacation day if in a big group.

Opulent, fascinating, photogenic. A beautiful place to visit at any time of year. The building exteriors are really fabulous and the gardens are well kept, extensive and photogenic- although in the colder months the many statues are covered in protective crates. The souvenir shops are tucked away near the splendid cafe.Inside, the many pieces of art, furniture and fittings are fabulous. A must.

The Eye Popping Beauty of Catherine Palace and PArk. Eye popping beauty - a little too much gilding for our taste, but gorgeous. Amber room was beautiful. The park has gorgeous serene gardens and pavilions. The pavilions have at least one with fantastic acoustics where there are singers who sing at intervals to demonstrate the acoustics. The performance is free but tourists can support them with a small donation or buying their pricey CD. Get a guide - that will increase the enjoyment of the art.Other pavilions have specialized dining rooms with the kitchen on the bottom floor and gust table above. The tables and chairs are set up witth a pulley system and can be lowered or cleaning or setting up and raised when all set up. Fascinating to see that.

Wow, wow, wow - beautiful. Such an opulent palace and almost scary that someone had so much wealth. The palace is stunning to say the least with gold everywhere. Worth a visit and the gardens are beautiful too.

A little too much gold but beautiful grounds. Catherine's palace is definitely worth a visit, and helps break up the drive to Peterhof if you are headed there. However, I thought it was a little monotonous. Every room is covered in gold leaf and mirrors. They look pretty similar. The grounds and various buildings are beautiful and walking around in nice weather is lovely.
Just beautiful. The inside of this place is like nothing I have ever seen before, it just amazing the gold on the columns and the stairs and the walls it's 22 carat gold everywhere.

Great Experience. Wonderful grounds and a palace to rival any in Europe. We had a wonderful guide, Maria, arranged through our hotel, Alexander House Hotel and.she gave us an experience to remember. Don't miss the Kremlin and Black Sea which are within the grounds

A Very Interesting Palace.. Another great tourist site in St. Petersburg. We visited here whilst in town on a cruise ship and it was great. Tip....make sure you visit this palace with a guide to be able to explain the history and highlights.

Amazing. Totally stunning building and grounds, restored after the Nazi's burnt it to the ground when fleeing. Prepare to be overwhelmed by the sheer scale and grandeur of God place, it takes your breath away. The reconstructed Amber Room is truly memorising.

The jewel in the crown. What a spectacular palace this is, we took a tour trip out of St Petersburg via a coach, we were in the city with a P&O cruise of the Baltic.It's about a 45 minute journey, depending on the traffic in the city, and you MUST get there early, or the queues and the crowds are horrendous, we left the city at 07.30, and it opens at 08.30, but we were in the first 100 or so waiting to get in, by 08.30 I expect another 7 or 8 coaches had arrived, and the queues were already starting to become big.Once inside, you cannot believe the opulence of the decor and fixtures and fittings, it must be one of the top 5 palaces in the world, and so perfectly restored by the USSR at the time.You have to see the pictures of how it was left after the world war 2, the Palace was almost totally destroyed, it's the point where he Germans got to and besieged the city, because it sits on higher ground, it became the artillery site against the city, and was treated very badly.To see it today, you wouldn't believe it had sustained so much damage and abuse, it feels like the royal family still lives inside, and the amber room is the only one of its kind in the world I think, truly magnificent.Without doubt this is a must see site if your visiting st Petersburg, it will always be a memory that you will never see again.

Amazing!. The shear enormity of this Palace will take your breath away! It is not to be missed. It's very crowded but if you have a good guide you will enjoy the tour. This palace is not always on the list of sites to see when visiting SPB because their are so many sites to see! Be sure to include this one. I rate it very highly along with the Hermitage Museum

Just Amazing. Wow, Catherine's Palace. Just absolutely amazing. The amount of gold leaves you breathless and the Amber Room was just astounding. Every room was just grander than the other. Well worth the visit

No green light for the Amber Room. Maybe I was just palaced-out, but I didn't consider the one hour journey out and same back (more if during rush hours) worth the effort. The main feature of this palace - The Amber Room - was a disappointment. Smaller and less impressive that I had imagined, with little time to enjoy what there was as each group has to keep moving forward to let the next one in. If you have plenty of time in St Petersburg then include it in your itinerary; if you have to drop something then I would suggest this is the one.

Breathtaking!. Gold and Amber and opulence at its best! Every room is more decadent than the last. The gardens are pristine. Words can not describe this breathtaking palace. Visiting here will certainly be a high point of your entire trip.

A Must. Went there after visiting Peterhof as part of our two day visit of St Petersburg from our cruise. Another excellent and superb palace wonderfully preserved for us all to enjoy. the outside is so grand and ornate and the interior is even more elaborate. make this a place to visit when you visit St Petersburg

Amber room is beautiful. We splurged and took a small group tour set up by the hotel - Lucky us, there were only 4 total people on the tour. Despite being early May, the Palace was very crowded. This was the best place we found for high end souvenirs.

Decadent. You're expecting opulence but you still can't quite believe it. This summer residence at Pushkin, about 15 miles from St. Petersburg, was commissioned by Empress Elizabeth, who wanted something flamboyant. Well. Unveiled in 1756, it was about a fifth of a mile long with 220 pounds of gold on the facade. Germans destroyed it after the siege of Leningrad, and seized the famed Amber Room, which had been a gift from the Prussians in 1716. Reconstruction took until 2003 and the result is spectacular, especially when you get to be among the first tours to go through. Pictures aren't allowed in the Amber Room.

Beautiful place to visit. We visited the palace and park in August 2015 as part of our cruise excursion to St Petersburg. There is so much to see here and history to absorb. Fantastic works of Art on display and the decor is stunning. The Park is beautifully maintained. We were lucky with warm sunny weather. Highly recommended and not to be missed if visiting St Petersburg.
Gold. Gold gold gold gold gold! This is where all the gold is! Amber Amber Amber! This is where all the Amber is! Beautiful! All of it!
History!. Was lovely to walk round the gardens and to be able see how the rich lived and what wealth they had.
Fabulous. This was a lovely place to visit. Do not miss it. Magnificent buildings. We were with an official tour and even then we had to queue for a while as it is popular.
Spectacular!. Mind blowing! fantastic experience so very pleased we saw it. Could have been there all day and still needed more time! So much to see.

catherine Palace. This Palace has to be visited if you go to St peteresburg. The opulence of this palace has to be seen to be believed. Its extraordinary that someone could live in a Palace like this, its huge. The refurbishments are still continuing 70 years after the Germans destroyed much of it during world war 2.

Another beautiful palace and gardens. I preferred this over the Peterhof palace. The exterior is just as jaw dropping to me and the interiors are often just as elaborate and stunning to see in my opinion. Plus you can take pics inside. You can't take them in the Amber room, which is the highlight though. It may not be the original but the work done to reproduce this room to every detail is just incredible. Such lovely colours.A wonderful moment being in this room.The gardens are quite nice but no fountains. However they are often just as lovely with the lake and panorama section and the small Hermitage building and others dotted about.

Don't miss it, it's magnificent. As was the Hermitage the palace is most beautiful and well furnished which gives you a true impression of what life must of been like for the royals of the time. Don't miss it.

wow. wow. wow.. you can spend days in the park and some more days in the palace (s). there is so much to explore. all the pavillons in the park, the two magnificent palaces (catherine and alexander). all worth a look from the outside as well as from the inside. definitely worth the money.

Don't miss Catherine's Palace!. Absolutely beautiful. One of the prettiest palaces we have seen. Over the top and looks like something out of fairytale! A great book to read before you go is Catherine the Great by Robert Massie.
Since there were no golf courses. This place is nice,but a lot of effort to get there..Peterson was at least twice the experience. I would have preferred a day of golf.
Exquisite palace. Exquisite rooms and meticulous landscape. Well worth the trip outside the city. Gift shop has wonderful selection of quality items.

Breathtakingly beautiful. This is the main attraction, in my view, of St.Petersburg. Wonderful display, spectacular rooms, the most famous is of course the Amber Room; but I found the the Grand Hall grandiose. Do not miss the visit but be sure to book tickets on line!

Amazing. If you are in St Petersburg you must go here. This is one of the most beautiful palaces I have ever seen. The Amber Room is the real highlight of the tour. The splendor of this building is unsurpassed. It is definitely worth the ride from the city of St Petersburg to come here.

Catherine the Great's Summer Palace. Gorgeous palace & gardens of Catherine the Great an hour from St. Petersburg. While much of the palace was destroyed by the Nazis during WWII, it has been perfectly restored to its former brilliance. The Amber Room is a feat of artistic magnificence and one just flows from one beautiful room to the next. The gilding and craftsmanship is something to behold. A "must see"!
Catherine Palace. This is a "must see" when visiting the St. Petersburg area. Catherine's Palace is full of history and beauty.

Not to be missed.. This was a half day trip out to the palace and started with a tour of the inside of the palace. The interior is stunning and is a monument to opulence. Once outside the gardens that you can glimpse from inside the palace are spectacular. But for a real impression, make sure you are at the bottom of the steps by the fountains when they are turned on at 11am. The mixture of the increasing flow of fountains and the stirring music provide an unforgettable experience. Definitely a must do excursion amongst the beauty that is St Petersburg.
Worth seeing. Worth the drive outside of St. Petersburg. Beautiful rooms but they and the garden are not as impressive as at Peterhoff palace.
