Key Attraction. A distance from the city. Crowded. Worth it. Major art and artifacts and landscaping. It it their Versaille.
Afternoon at Catherine Palace. Really enjoyed the tour around the palace especially seeing the photos from the end of the war and how badly the palace looked then. Excellent restoration work.
brilliant. SPb tours also arranged for us to visit the Amber Workshop this was an exclusive the craftsmen highlighted the need to continue with restoration.

Tsarskoe Selo Pushkin Cathrine's Palace. My husband and I enjoyed our St. Petersburg sightseeing experience with our private guide Nastya. She is very knowledgably in history of Russia as art history as well. We appreciated her faultless English. Thanks to her we have seen all point of interest in Tsarsko Selo during day and the most popular point of St.Petersburg in the afternoon. Our journey from St.Petersburg to Pushkin was an adventure we will never forget. Amazing Amber Room in Catherine’s Palace we will remember forever and also the huge park with number of buildings in the Park such as Camron Gallery, Hermitage Pavilion, Creaking Pavilion,… . One pavilion had a special acoustic. There was a concert of male sextet. That was something special. Like there were 50 singers and not only 5. They were singing Russians songs. One was about Neva river…. We also saw statue Girl with a Pitcher, Pushkin’s statue, Church of the Sign,Lycee, Alexsander Palace,…Nastya is very well organized and got us through lineups without any delay. She also chose interesting and inexpensive local restaurant in Pushkin for a lunch and we had a nice break. There we had a lovely time and tasted great local food as Borsch and super Cake with Honey. We tried local drinks: kvas and Cranbery juice which we liked very much. It was a perfect day. Thanks to Nastya we have seen all that in only one day tour. Antonela
Pushkin. We enjoyed Catherine Palace (Pushkin) must better than Peterhof.i would recommend to use a private tour guide to get there. it is a bout an hour drive from central Saint Petersburg.

Opulence at its highest!. Each room is more elegant than the next. Floors and ceilings are beautiful. Restoration is really amazing since so much was destroyed. The "Amber Room" is a site to see and a guide is recommended as they are so knowledgeable. It is a drive to go to outside St. Petersburg but well worth the trip.
Nice decoration. Lots of amazing painting and stuff using in those period are showing.Should open more rooms to show.Not open everyday, have to check time first.

Amber Room and Palace are Stunning. We visited this palace and park with a tour group - well worth walking inside. One room is more opulent than the next. The Amber Room is a replica - the original was removed during WWII and has never been located. The palace was nearly completely bombed and destroyed during the war, but has been beautifully renovated. Worth the visit!

Amber Room and more. Considering that this and most other attractions in St.Petersburg were badly damaged and almost destroyed during the World War II, it is remarkable how well Catherine's Palace has been restored. Unlike the Hermitage, this one is about a 30 to 40 minute drive from the center of St.Petersburg but well worth it. Tour guides push a nearby Amber workshop, but you might want to skip it and spend more time in the Palace and surrounding park.

Lovely Place, Interesting History - Wonderful Restoration. This is a bit of a drive from downtown St. Petersburg but it is worth the visit because it is such an integral part of the Tsar's history. It helps put everything in perspective. The sheer amount of treasures here is amazing - makes you understand why the Russian's revolted! The amber room, while a replica vs. the original is still over the top and again helps you appreciate the crazy drive for treasures. The gardens are beautiful as well. Seeing pictures of what this place looked like after the war and how it is now helps you again appreciate the painstaking restoration efforts. Worth the trip.
Amazing. Amazing palace,the Amber room is glorious we toured with a private guide who gave us a lot of information.
Worth the trip. Breath taking. Worth the drive out. Hard to image the extent of the recovery that needed to be done after the war. A huge under taking that should be applauded.
Beautiful fountains and gardens. Stunning Palace with amazing gardens and stunning water fountains. Lots of walking but its worth it.

Magnificent but crowded. We visited in the evening for a tour and musical performance. It is located in the town of Pushkin outside St. Petersburg.The palace tour was very crowded with not a lot of time to linger. The guide moved the tour along at fast pace. Each room of the place was magnificent with large quantities of gold leaf and interesting paintings and furnishings. The famous Amber room is the highlight. An entire room covered with beautiful Amber. The Palace is restored palace since it was badly damaged in WWII .Visits in the summer will probably be crowded.

Superb and Magnificent. This huge, extravagant, and yet, elegant Palace is still undergoing a lot of restoration. But what is completed is truly magnificent. The furnishings, artwork, jewelry, clothes, paintings are all absolutely gorgeous and stunning.There are no words to sum up the opulence. Everything is well preserved and showcased well. The wealth and the power of the Russian Royalty is very evident in everything you see here – huge glided rooms, painted ceilings, imported silk wallpaper, awesome period furniture, and china from all over the world, -- and so much more.The wood floors inside are amazing. They are spectacularly designed, and superbly maintained. All visitors have to wear booties to preserve them.The fully restored “Amber Room” was opulent, spectacular, unbelievable and unique. No photos are allowed in this room. The guards are very particular and strict about this.The Palace is over 1000 feet long. The facade has tons and tons of gold gilding. The grandeur is simply staggeringThe Gardens are amazing and lovely. Everything is manicured, symmetrical, and color coordinated.There is a lot of walking involved in the long corridors, and up and down the stairs. So come prepared for that. Our guided tour kept up the pace, otherwise we would have been stuck in those crowds, or stayed there simply gawking.The Palace completely lived up to our expectations from what we had read about it. We were just not prepared for the sensory overload. It was one of the most beautiful and unique Palaces we have seen.Definitely a “Must Visit” place.
Fabulous. This is the best place i have ever seen.glamorous and beautiful.please Take my advice and visit it...
Must Visit. Fair distance from St. Peters burg but worth a trip.Must see Amber room. Beware of traffic going and coming into St. Peters burg.
Another highlight of St Petersburg.. This is a wonderful place to walk around.Make sure you stay long enough to see all the fountains and wander around the gardens. You will enjoy it.
A must see!. Wow! A magnificent building. One can but try to imagine what it must have been like when Catherine ruled. A living history lesson.

Another Must See. One of the top three attractions to make time for. This gives one a true sense of what made Catherine the Great. She was quite a woman. Her Palace is well preserved and huge. The grounds are large and well worth a walk through.
Visit to Catheine Palace at Pushkin. Another very good spot to visit, but once you see Hermitage Museum, you can browse through this one fairly quickly. I would suggest in abut two hrs or so.

Opulent to say the least!!!. This place was amazing. I'll admit that after seeing multiple palaces, churches, etc., dripping in gold and opulence you might say why? This place was just cool, the history, which I usually don't pay to much attention to, kept me very interested. This lady had 15,000 dresses, and was a party girl...very interesting to see how she lived. The outside garden areas are very nice as well. The amber room was amazing.

Catherine's Palace. So beautiful! so glad they are gradually restoring it to the grand beauty of it's ages, So hard to believe the destruction of WWII and what they have been able to do to ring it back to so much incredible beauty. Don't miss!!

Stunning amazing Catherine Palace spoiled by bad organisation. Again stunning but too many tourists trapped in queues on stairs and no regard for safety. We had private tour guide but we're still treated like cattle. They need to up their game. Restrooms awful and too few.
Gold. Room after room of art work and gold and gold leaf. The opulence is unbelievable. This was one of the highlights of the visit to St. Petersburg.

Most beautiful palace i have ever seen!. I first heard the name 'Tsaksoye selo' in the movie Zoya. I later found out that it means Tsar's village. The palace and grounds are definitely worth the name. When I first looked at the palace through the beautiful gate, it looked so beautiful that it felt unreal. I enjoyed visiting its beautiful interiors. Room after room...one better than the other. I especially liked the ballroom. Absolutely stunning. A must see if you come to St.Petersburg. The gardens are also very pleasant to take a walk in.
Amber room is the popular destination. Another great museum and architectural structure. Vast and impressive with the highlight being the amber room. Photographs are unfortunately not permitted.
The Grandeur that is St Petersburg !!!!!. A must see and part of most tours. Makes Buckingham Palace look small. Was part of our two day tour w TJ Travel ( see our review)

Grandiose. We visited as part of an excursion with Anastasia Travel so did not need to queue for entry as our visit was pre-arranged by tour company/guide. Absolutely amazing architecture and interiors. The gold gilding and ornate designs were astounding and the reconstruction of the Amber Room was amazing. The craftsmanship on display was of the highest standard and the costs involved in building, restoration and up-keep of this site must be excessive. It was definitely worth seeing and gave a fabulous overview of the lives of the Tzars and Tzarinas.

Beautiful palace of catherine the Great .. Exquisite palace, beautifully restored at Pushkin. Amber room is a Must see as is the great room . Again too many tours to really appreciate it but do not miss Shame about the herding process.
Stunning. Amazing rooms full of history and beautiful things. The Amber room is beautiful the restoration of this incredible building is excellent.

World Class, even if Amber Room not Original. The amount of money the czars spent on palaces makes you understand what a good deal it was to have most of the population be unpaid serfs. Even when I learned that the Amber Room that we see now was rebuilt because the Nazis stole the original, it is still fantastic. Our guide (TJ Travel) found the interior elevator, but there were still about 10 stairs to climb from the outside. Also, they will closely examine the tires of the wheelchair to ensure it will not mark the floors. I brought (but did not need) wheel covers just in case.

A palace designed by a woman, very feminine but over the top.. This place is over the top but you cannot help being amazed at the work which went into this palace and park. The grounds were my favorite. You do leave wondering how anyone could have lived in this amazing "museum." All the gold used for gilding could probably fill one of our own homes to the brim.

Stunning!. This was the summer palace of Catherine the Great. Spectacular as are all of the palaces in Russia/St. Peteresburg. It actually gets overwhelming but is breathtaking. We were there on a summer day but the weather was rainy and cold, a bit bleak but the majestic palace,art and history made up for any temporary discomfort due to weather. Prepare for crowds from all over the world. We had a private guide ( there were only 4 of us including her) so we didn't have to stand in line. The Amber Room was the only room where photos weren't allowed - the guide said it would slow down the crowds but it's in my mind forever! It's worth the drive and the town us quite charming.
Amazing. Just soak up the history of this place and enjoy one of the great summer palaces of the Zars. The amber room is a must see for sure

Gorgeous with an amazing story. What makes this gorgeous palace special, beyond the incredible decor, art, and furnishings, is the fact that this place was basically taken apart piece by piece and reconstructed following being decimated during the war. The building itself was nearly demolished by the Germans, but the Russians had the forethought to remove most of the important artifacts in advance of the siege and shipped them to Siberia for safe keeping. Following the war, the building itself and the contents were redone to exact, pre-war specifications, using original plans and photographs. They did an amazing job. The process is shown on some well-done displays, with photographs of the palace before, during, and after reconstruction. What they managed to accomplish is truly incredible.Inside and out, this place is awesome and well worth a visit. I know it's easy to get palace and museum fatigue in Europe, but the story behind this one makes it different. Besides, the Amber Room is really one of a kind and worth the price of admission. Give yourself a couple of hours to see things without being rushed.

Beautiful Amber Room. This palace is beautiful! The ballrooms, the dining rooms, the staircase, the floors, and of course the Amber Room. When first entering the Amber Room it's overwhelming. But walk closer and see the artistic detail eveywhere!
Beautiful inside and out!. Don't leave St Petersburg without seeing this! As you can tell from the picture the outside itself is beautiful and you won't be disappointed inside. Go!

Its a must in a city full of musts.. This place is grand beyond belief, until you visit the next grand beyond belief czarist palace. I agree it's a must, but like cathedrals in Europe, after a while, despite the unbelievable grandness, they all seem pretty much the same. I was taken with the restoration of the palace after it was trashed, burned and blown up by the Nazis. This is the 70th anniversary of the siege of Leningrad and the damage done to its national treasures-- I found the care in restoration fascinating.

A Must!!. We have been here twice over the years & loved it both times. Be prepared for crowds, especially in the summer. Your patience might be tested when aggressive tour groups are ahead of/behind you, but your tolerance will be worth it. We enjoyed every room, although the amber room is the most famous. Such opulence throughout!

a grand palace. when you arrive at this palace you are in awe of the size and architecture of the palace. why anyone ever needed something of this magnitude is mind boggling. it is safe to say that to build it again would be near impossible. the beauty of each room, the art, the details are overwhelming. we used viator for our tour, and had one of the greatest tour director i have ever had. if you book the day tour be sure to ask for roman. he was outstsanding.

Catherine Palace St. Petersburg, Russia.... A majestic building restored to its old glory with an exquisite collection of fine furniture , paintings, decor, art and unique items that is hard to describe.. A real piece of history and Russian grandeur of the past.
wow. Amazing art.Most importantly you must see the photos post war and how they renovated it.The entire roof was blown off and now we have the best possible museum.

Beautiful Restoration with a story. We visited this beautifully restored palace with our great guide Irina Mitireva from All Russia Tours. She managed to get us in without the long lines both in terms of timing our visit and because we were a "small group" just us. The palace is magnificent even with only the Amber room close to original at the time the palace was built. But the wonderful story of the restoration after the war is very powerful and the palace and grounds provide an important insight into the Russian history. Incredible artistry by both the original builders and those who dedicated their talents to the restoration. We would absolutely put this on any visit to St Petersburg's must see list.
Spectacular. possibly the most beautiful of St. Petersburg palaces. The amber room was magnificent. The gold domes are stunning.
Catherine Palace. What a lovely palace and marvelous displays; Catherine was one of the powerful Tsarinas and her collection is definetly woth seeing. A must do.
Fantastic. Please go with a guide and early before all of the buses arrive.1 hour drive from St. Petersburg. Grand palace in the rococo style.
Beautiful Palace. Part of our Best Guides Tour where we were guided through this magnificent building a nd grounds. Stands easy comparison with other significant Palaces around Europe.

Blue Rococo version of the Winter Palace with some modifications. What we see today as Catherine Palace is the product of several 18th century reconstructions reflecting the varying tastes of empresses - from Catherine I to Elizabeth to Catherine II! The result, ultimately, is more of the same of what we saw at the Hermitage & Petergof, Italian elegance, unrestrained extravagant luxury & over-ornate decoration, but it is every bit as magnificent as those other Romanov palaces - probably more so. The quadrangle-shaped building has many unbelievably beautiful rooms & gold encrusted apartments, the Picture Hall, the Amber Chamber, the Green Dining Room, & so on. Again the interior recollects the majesty of Versailles, especially with its similarity to the Hall of Mirrors. The manicured parks are equally as fascinating as those at the Summer Palace, with their expansive relaxing areas, gardens, lakes & canals, unusual hedge patterns, etc. The Cameron Galleries with its bronze busts of famous historical figures & other sculptures is not to be missed either. In one of the lakeside buildings we heard an excellent performance of "the Volga Boatman" from a vocal quartet. The only disappointment at the Tsarskoye Selo palace was the limited lunch options on site, the relatively new pectopaH was booked out on the day we visited, & we had a long wait for service at the other food outlet.
So much to see!. Amazingly huge palace with SO much to see! Make sure you have some sort of guide so you can really learn about the different rooms.

Important and exciting attraction. We visited here recently, via a tour, in large part because our time was limited and it was easier than figuring out the transportation to and from the city. The palace was indeed as impressive as expected with many beautiful rooms. Our guide (from City Tours) was very good and I particularly enjoyed the information about how different members of the royal family approached the decor of the palace. Learning about the restoration post WWII was also very interesting. The grounds were also lovely. I would try to visit if you can squeeze this in. I believe the tour saved time.

Absolutely stunning. The palace and surrounding gardens are stunning. Every room has a story and our guide (Ekaterina from Altura Tours) was fantastic. What is so amazing about this palace is the fact it was destroyed by the Germans in WWII, but has been painstakingly restored to it's former self in such a way you would never know.Gold everywhere, silk wallpaper, and of course there is The Amber Room which is truly amazing.The gardens are beautiful and we were treated to a small but delightful recital from 5 male singers in one of the buildings. I was so impressed I bought one of the CDs.Very busy with lots of queues (which we managed to avoid), and I would also strongly suggest a guide or tour to fully appreciate the history of this place.

Awesome!. Visited as part of a day tour of St Petersburg, we spent a little time in this fabulous building. The queues inside (particularly the Gold Room) were slow on occasion due to visitor numbers but the quality of the experience made up for this.

Nice palace with the park. If you have time to visit it you will not regret it. You must go by car, but it is not only the palace, but also the Park which is huge that you have to see. Plan at least 5 hours to see it (including the drive)
Beautiful . One of the beautiful and rich attractions I visited in the city. It's so beautiful and full of history. The garden is the most beautiful garden I saw. I strongly recommend it. Enjoy. . .

Not the original. Worth visiting only if you are a museum fan. It is not the original building and there are a lot of restoration works that keep on going. Would not suggest to a friend. The only thing I would suggest is the amber room. Unfortunatelly you have to visit the whole thing

Experience Royalty and Opulence here. Catherine Palace and the surrounding gardens make you feel like a royalty. It is quite a long drive to Pushkin, but we did not experience any traffic jams, and in the afternoon, crowds weren't too bad either.Huge gilded rooms, fine furniture, imported silk wallpaper and imported china serving pieces are everywhere. Shoe covers are needed to protect the Parquet floors. Outside grounds and gardens were very well maintained.Like all other places, you can always want more time there if possible. Instead use the time you have to hit the highlights. A guided tour, which we had, helps move you through and cover the main areas.

A Palace fit for an Empress. We were privileged to take a private tour of 4 people with a guide who knew the site intimately.We were also lucky that there were not too many tourists which enabled us to enjoy this magnificent site to the utmost.The grounds are spectacular but the palace is the real gem. The richness of the decor is almost indescribable and there is enough gold foil on the walls to finance many a treasure for a few months. The magnificence of the Amber Room defies description.This was our second visit and under more relaxed circumstances we seemed to see more and definitely enjoy it more.
Woow. Must see in St. Petesburg, Amazing. Recommend to anyone going, almost included in all tours. Make sure to see the gardens as they are great.

An outstanding palace. A wonderful place to visit.The gardens are also stunning and the Amber room is out of this world.The palace was destroyed during WW II by the Germans and wahat is astonishing is the huge effort put in by the Russians to rebuild it almost exactly including the Amber Room. A visit to Catherine"s is not only a tribute to those who built the Palace originally but also to those who first did everything to save it before the German occupation and then to those who restored it. Absolutely stunning place. . The comfortable way to reach Pushkin is by train from Vibetsky Railway station (adjoining Pushkinaya Metro Station).It takes exactly 30 minutes and then a bus ride to the palace for another 10/15 minutes. Lots of buses are available just outside the station. Buy a return ticket for the train journey and retain it for exiting the Vibetsky Train on your return. Whole journey is comfortable and costs only 80 rubles return fare.To avoid the queues for the palace ticket buy it online. !00 tickets are avaible daily and cost 1000 rubles per head.The whole visit becomes a very easy exercise.

Stunning palace and make sure you explore the gardens. Lovely palace and gardens. Be aware in busy times it can get very busy in the palace and you have to queue to get time slots to visit. If you only want the gardens and outside views of the palace there are desperate kiosks with few people. If you are brave enough (speak Russian) get a cheap a marshrutka from Kupchina metro station

Stunning Palace and Lovely Grounds. Catherine Palace and the surrounding gardens were indeed stunning. One can appreciate how this contrasted with the poverty and starvation the peasants endured and understand how the revolution eventually was all but certain. Huge gilded rooms, fine furniture, imported silk wallpaper and imported china serving pieces were everywhere in the palace. Parquet floors, which required shoe covers to be worn, were incredible. The grounds and gardens were very impressive. Crowds were thick but manageable. Strongly suggest a guide or tour to fully appreciate the site.
Great Attraction well worth the journey. Really fabulous scenery and the amber room is awesome. Even the tourist knick knacks at the stalls outside were good value.

More over-the-top Russian opulence . Catherine wasn't fooling around. Beautiful, eclectic palace and grounds. I took a tour, mostly so I could get transport out there. Tour guide was meh. But the palace and grounds made up for it. Inside the palace is a madhouse of tour groups-- but suck it up and then go breathe in the expansive and varied gardens!
Impressive history. The amber room is impressive and you should not miss the relaxing park. I recommend to go with your family.
Iconic palace. Huge, crowded, but an iconic example of the palaces built by Russian czars. If it sounds too exhausting, take the short tour, which includes the Amber Room.
wonderful. So much to see here and the site does get very busy. We had an excellent guide on our trip. Of course the building itself is something else - but the contents!

Beautiful Palace. We visited Catherine Palace as part of a cruise tour group. While we left our ship fairly early in the morning, it is still a fair drive out to Pushkin and the crowds were already forming at the entrance. The palace is stunningly beautiful and is an absolute must see while in St. Petersburg. I wish we'd had more time to visit the palace. As our tour was continuing on to see the Hermitage, we were rushed through and did not get to see the gardens. The palace deserves a good half day visit all on its own to properly enjoy the beauty of the property and the charming town of Pushkin. Recommend getting there early to avoid the worst of the crowds, especially if the cruise ships are in town.

Do not miss....Stunning!. Yet another "must see" when visiting St. Petersburg. A bit out of the city but worth the drive. The town of Pushkin is also charming which surrounds this palace. The lavishness of this place is unbelievable. Hard to take it all in there is so much to look at. Recommend going in the morning or on a day that is not hot as there is no air conditioning and not much air flow. I was happy we were there in good weather conditions. We were there as part of our 3 day tour which was good with respect to preferential admission and flow.

Picturesque Palace. Catherine Palace is absolutely stunning. The renovations have to be seen to be believed. The amount of gold used in the decorations is breathtaking and the amber room leaves you speechless with the craftsmanship. Definitely worth a trip outside of the city.

Impressive Great Hall Gilded with Gold. My favorite part was the Great Hall, with sumptuous gold decor. The Amber Room was a little disappointing - mostly a patchwork of amber slabs used as wall covering.We went in early June and it was super crowded.TIPS:1. Visit here BEFORE the Hermitage to let Catherine Palace shine in its own right, because the Hermitage is even more impressive.2. Be sure to allow at least one hour to walk the gardens - splendid greenery and statues.

Wow a beauty. What a treat this was. The palace is beautiful and the gardens lovely . The crowds were a bit hectic though. History is so rich and down certain corridors there are amazing historic photos. Some ceilings and floors breath taking.

Stunning!!. Worth a trip out to this place. Although it's incredibly crowded and there are queues it's worth the time just to see the individual rooms including the Amber room and all of the Delft work. The gardens are also worth spending time in but again be prepared to be jossled.

Beautiful park. While the palace is just as beautiful as the other palaces you can visit near Petersburg, the real surprise is the park. It is very well maintained, with a lot of marvelous vistas. The park is also home of beautiful birds and squirrels who will not hesitate to come to your hands to get fed.
Stunningly beautiful. No words can describe. This is simply a must see when you come to St Petersburg. You will take lots of pictures!

buy tickets online in the high season!. If you know you can't visit the palace , take the queue at the first ticket machine!Don't queue up at the long line for the castle and park desk (the last one);As such you avoid waiting for something you won't do anyway, the palace.If you can't come in the morning , forget about the palace because the only thing left will be tickets for the late afternoon or evening (on Monday). A good alternative is buying your tickets online, something we regret not having done.

highlight of our trip. Spend time here. The grounds of the palace are beautiful. we booked online and collected the tickets at the ticket counter. This was a wise decision as the queues were long. Once we entered, we paid for the audio guide and started the tour. this palace is a treasure. The amber room was the best part. We could not visit the rooms beyond the butler's room as these were under renovation.Restaurant on the ground floor is basic but good

Tsarist splendour. very crowded but of course impressive building, room and parks. A pity that so few rooms are open to the public in summer. I was most impressed with how this was rebuilt after the war ... even more impressive than building it originally in my view, because the relevant craftsmen's skills were so much rarer
Just Amazing!. Wow...a must see! This Palace is beautiful and large. Each room is more amazing than the last. This is how one builds a palace!

A must see. The Catherine Palace is a marvel that worth visiting. The Amber room is there.The Catherine Palace is surrounded by a Garden a la francaise and an English landscape garden, and other marvels 18th-century structures. I visited in November, the lake was frozen and the landscape was wonderful

Fantastically rebuilt palace. Wonderful palace and wondefull park, well worth of a visit. usually it is organized and therefore time limited, but you could easily spend half a day here, especially if the weather is nice (because of the park).

SO much grandeur!. This was a magnificent palace & garden to visit in St Petersburg. There is so much gold, mirrors & grandeur that it is overwhelming. It is really something to see on tour or with a private guide. It is one of Russia's Crown Jewels. We went early on a Sunday morning, which was great as far as less crowds than later in the day.
Catherines ego trip. In a word - mind-boggling, at least the jobless rate would have been low maintaining all those ornately adorned rooms.
Just wonderful. The splendour of this place was unbelievable much enhanced by our ever knowledgeable guide Sofia of TJ Travel

A piece of Russia . This a stop should be done to complete the Saint-Petersburg's visit. The palace is important for its contribution to understand a piece of Russian history and its heritage which is today present. Perfect organisation and maintenance.

A lovely trip in the sun. We took a boat here on a beautiful sunny day. The boat trip lasts about 50 minutes. The gardens and the palace looked magnificent, with enormous golden statues everywhere and beautiful gardens. We didn't bother going into the palace (an additional charge) as we were short of time. I think the weather would be a key factor in my decision to go here.

Gold, and elegance and beauty. The palace is sublimely beautiful. I suggest going through with a guide to explain things about it. It is very crowded and if you can go outside the heavy tourist season it would be better.

Well worth the visit. We thought the winter palace (as it's also called) was absolutely outstanding. The opulence and grandeur that you see throughout the palace is incredible. To see the colors and designs gave a completely different appreciation to Russian lifestyles. We were charged to be able to take photos, but noticed that there really wasn't anyone who checked if you had a photo ticket once you paid up front. But eh, whatever. The pictures came out great. So much history and so much beauty.

Spectacular Palace - Breathtaking. While the Amber Room is the highlight, the restoration after WWII is impressive in itself and the guilded rooms demonstrate the elegance and craftsmanship of the era when it was constructed.

Stunning, Storybook Palace. Came on an individually guided tour in 2014. Breathtaking views of the grand ballroom, Amber Room, and many other rooms, though a little crowded/rushed through the palace itself. (Non-flash) photos OK everywhere except the Amber Room. Also toured the gardens. Some renovations in progress, yet everything was pristine and beautiful. A must see if visiting SPB.

Don't waste your time....long way to go to see the same old thing. We went to St. Catherine's on SPB tour probably because we were in the area of Puskin. We went to Peterhof which was wonderful - then a lovely lunch - and finally St. Catherine's. It's pretty much the same as Yusupov palace...just do one.

Stunning inside and out!. This building is beautiful on the outside in a huge, huge, square. It's a museum on the inside and you could spend a couple of days inside. I would use the services of a guide to get to the best bits. The internal decoration is simply stunning! Beautiful paintings and artwork too, with great views of the river.

Worth the trip, Amber room selfie: check!. It take a while to get past the chinese all inclusive tourists but its worth. Funny enough you are not allowed to take pictures in the amber room. So just ignore the guards and take photos. Its easy to get there by public busses and quicker than expected .

Glory in the Present!. This palace is exquisite! It is still in the rehab stage. The story behind the hiding of the artifacts during the war and the return of the art work is worth the research and the study.

Catherine Palace Tour. Still renovating, but plenty to see, a real example of the opulence of the Tsars (or Tsarinas to be precise), as usual in Russia a guide helps enormously to get the historical detail.
The Amber room was an awesome site to see!!!. The Amber room was awesome!!! The walk in the garden was great! The whole place was a site to see!!!

Lovely Palace and Garden but Palace Too Crowded. The Palace and Gardens are lovely. But in the larger rooms Tour Groups became mixed-up and with the large number of visitors and it was difficult to take photos of the rooms with so many people walking around. Confusion increased when the "Room Officials" decided for certain Groups to change the route taken through the Palace.At the end of WWII the Palace was left in a really poor condition, with parts distroyed. The rennovation work has been amazing - well done.Most rooms on display had lots of Gold and Mirrors - a little too much for me but I was impressed by the work of the skilled craftsmen. During WWII the Amber Room was looted but as part of the rennovation the Amber was replaced although thiner than the original. I really liked two painted rooms - which I called the "Wedgewood Rooms" - real class!The Gardens / Park was really lovely, especially in the sunshine.

Great palace too bad they don´t let you take pictures in some rooms.. This palace it is very nice I didn´t like they don´t let you take pictures of the Japanese room same as in the amber room not even without a flash and I don´t understand why. The only problem it is that it is very crowded in the summer time and it takes a lot of time to see it because of that, you have to follow everybody room by room go as early as possible.

Catherine Palace and Park, a must visit in St. Petersburg. Catherine Palace is so huge and beautiful, it has lots of rooms with different decorations. It is elegant, classic and gorgeous. It is amazing that every decoration and furnishing is delicate and refined. Catherine Park has a beautiful lake; it is peace and calm with beautiful flowers around it.
You have to see it to believe it!. Russia has done a great job in restoring the palace and making it available for of us. It is a must see attraction for anyone visiting St. Petersburg.

Not to be missed!. Despite the hundreds of visitors this richly decorated palace is a must. It's room after room of breathtaking decoration and beautiful artefacts. The amber room is truly spectacular.

Incredible Summer Palace. This is one of the amazing summer palaces that you find around Europe. Well worth seeing. We had a private guide who took us through otherwise it is so big it would be over whelming. Save some time to walk the gardens.
A favorite attraction. Beautiful rooms. Interesting details. Everything has a story. The Amber room exceeded expectations. Note: There IS an elevator for “older” visitors.
A Must on Tour. It is not open on every day ,But there is very good park and lot of things to see and enjoy in the park

Beautiful and grand. Our family (kids age 12-14) visited during our 3 day in port. The palace was grand and beautiful. The amber room was opulent. I would definitely do this with a guide so you can understand what you are looking at and what rooms were used for back in the days of the Romanovs. If you want extra credit, read Nicholas and Alexandra and you will understand what was going on during the use of all the beautiful places in St Petersburg

Magnificent Russian Palace near St Petersburg. This is a very inner interesting palace...architecture, grounds, interiors, artwork, historical importance and especially the restored Amber Room. This is very important in Russian history, from Catherine the Great, the Nazi occupation and damage to the palace. The restoration is still underway and the mystery of the whereabouts of the Amber Room's original Amber panels and contents continues. A nice day tour from St. Petersburg. They have a very good shop with lovely offerings at fair prices.

Secluded location but impressive park. The main palace is as other palaces in St Petersburg, or less grand than Peterhof. I would say Catherine Park steals the show here. Food in the park is also reasonable and tasty as compared to those in Peterhof. There's 2 or 3 restaurants in the park and I would recommend going to Bonkohckuu where the food is reasonably priced and good. Though the palace is situated in Pushskin, dont be intimidated by the travelling! From St Petersburg, take the metro to Moskoskyaya metro station. Take a public bus 186 or private mini buses to Catherine Palace from the bus stop opposite the metro station. There are quite a number of such mini buses which would bring you to Catherine Palace and some of them even have signs in English and Chinese. It cost 40 rubles per person for the mini buses. The bus driver of the mini bus was kind enough to alert us to alight when we reached.

Oh to have had more time. We were on cruise so booked a 2 day tour with TJ Tours and couldn't fault it. They know the palace well also no queues as pre booked. The amber room was amazing, especially finding out a small part of it was returned from Germany. It was all so stunning you realised what you'd seen when you looked at your photos on return home. Only the amber room were photos prohibited and you wouldn't want to argue with the ladies overseeing each room.
Bling!. Wow. what opulence. Another stunning Czarina's palace and gardens. Summer spent here must have been great. Go visit and spend time in the gardens. However be prepared for the queues.
Wow !. What a palace. A must to see. Visited as part of a 2 day tour. Get a guide as you learn so much about its history. So many beautiful things to see. Enjoy!

Well worth a visit. this is the summer palace of the tsars,so it has all the opulence you'd expect plus lovely parkland. Room after room leaves you gob smacked, and then you come to the famous Amber Room where words fail you. We thought it was fabulous, and we'd been to the Hermitage the previous day.It's about 30 mins from downtown St Petersburg. Go.

so beautiful - its unreal. amazing. stunning. sad to tears (i mean sad to remember what communists did to this place). Take a carriage ride around - this and Alexandre palace. It will cost you 5000 rouble regardless the number of people, so it could either be a romantic ride or a good company one, The carriage accommodates 5-6 persons. And to finalize - THIS IS FANTASTIC.
Opulence, beauty, art - all in one plce. Another of the Czars great creations. The palaces and grand buildings in Russia are on a par with anything mainland Europe has to offer.

Beautifully restored!. Catherine's Palace was stunning and it was amazing to see how well the restoration was handled! We thoroughly enjoyed our guided tour (Alla Tours) and found it to be very interesting!

Stunning and gorgeous. I wished that I had more time to enjoy the gardens. They were beautiful. The amber room was stunning. Unfortunately, we were not allowed to take pictures. A tour guide is a must but plan for extra time to wander the grounds. We were on a tight schedule and could not enjoy the whole area.
Palace tour was informative, and also very crowded.. Enjoyed touring the rooms and learning more about the history of the Palace. Even though we got there early there was crowds of people throughout.

One of the highlights of our trip. The family took a Baltic Sea cruise with two stopover days in St Petersburg. This was our first stop of the first day and was the most impressive! The fact that it was pretty much gutted out by the retreating nazis is what amazed me in that they brought it back to near original and likely better conditionThe gold guild on almost everything was a picture taking Mecca for my daughter and IWe really enjoyed this attraction and have been to many in Europe and N America!

Wow. Arrived at 0900 along with several hundred others. The place is very ornate both inside and outside. We were there in August and the temperature inside quickly became warm, the free cloakrooms were efficient and accurate with the way they provided tokens. The inside tour is one way, up the stairs and then along the back of the palace through amazingly beautiful rooms and then back length front of the building. Some of the rooms are narrower than others, resulting in sometimes the guide describing a room to you that you are not in. However the quality of the experience is not really reduced because it is all eye wateringly good. Had less time to spend outside in the gardens than we would have liked. It was a wonderful experience to see something out of St Petersburg, the trip from the city took about 40 minutes.
one of the highlights of our trip!. The Palace is simply breathtaking!! So much history and such an amazing place one has to see if you ever visit Saint Petersburg!

Our visit to Catherine Palace. The palace is crowded with many of the objects that Catherine collected in the long of her life. In my opinion it is not as crowded as Peterhoff palace but it has the sensation of being thught by the femenin taste. The park shows us the Catherine's sensibility and the Love for the beauty that he had.

Stunning. A must see attraction when visiting St. Petersburg!! The palace is usually crowded with guided tours towards mid-day and afternoon. It is a great idea to visit this palace first thing in the morning when the crowds are a little thinner.
Summer cruise to Russia/Scandinavia. A must see when traveling to St. Petersburg. It is beautiful and don't miss the Hermitage as well. Such an amazing city.

Interesting to see, but really crowded in July. Catherine's palaces was interesting to see, but oh the crowds. The queue started outside and if you are desperate for the toilets, as I was, they are inside and nothing in the grounds. The guide would not let me go in front with another group, even though we had tickets. Not a good start. Once inside, the crowds continued and we had to queue for around 20 mins, before we could start going through the rooms. Once it progressed however, it was not too bad. A lot of the rooms seemed similar to me and certainly it showed how the other half lived in Russia at the time the palace was built. It has been restored and maintained well and obviously very popular to visit she the large number of cruise ships docked.

Great way to spend a day!. Amazing out both inside this beautiful palace, full of treasures and in the gardens. A ferry or gondola ride across the lake is a relaxing way to spend the day. We travelled to Pushkin by train then a minibus which was an easy way to get there from the city.

Very beautiful. The town impressed me: lovely small houses and tidy lawns) The tickets to the park are sold freely but there are huge queues for the tickets to the palace. Everything was gorgeous and impressive! One serious disadvantage: the palace was badly destroyed during WWII and what we see now is a replica.

Do in conducted group tour if possible. The Cathedral visit is well conducted although you do feel like cattle at times due to the number of people. Best to do as part of a conducted tour as the line up is very long. While the palace is the most well known you must also walk through the gardens. Great photographic opportunities both in palace and gardens.

Amazing. Amazing palace. The art and architecture is awesome. Go early to avoid some of the crush at this popular sight. There is so much to see so allow lots of time. The Amber Room alone is worth the visit.

Gorgeous palace - must see. We were warned about long queues for the tickets, so were prepared to spend an hour , but to our surprise it took only 20 mins. Again you can purchase 2 types of tickets, to the park only, and to the park and palace. We took option 2. The park is beautiful, but not more than Petergof, also it is mostly covered with sand, and if you are there on a windy day (as we were), then it might be a little unpleasant. The palace is just amazing! Absolutely must see! All the rooms and especially amber room are impressive. It was sad to see photos of what happened to the park during WW2, but thanks to the russian government for the restoration of such beautiful piece of architecture.

A thing of beauty!. Husband & I went on a ship excursion to Catherine's Palace. Words cannot adequately describe how beautiful this place is. She really had a thing for GOLD! Elaborate in every way. Lots of walking but with all that beauty around you - you forget about your tired feet. A must see! Also be sure & buy a pastry from the coffee & pastry vendor just as you go out to see the gardens. I had the most delicious chocolate croissant I've ever eaten off that little cart. The gardens are lovely & there are more photo opportunities than you can count at Catherine's.

amazing. Visited with a tour guide from St. Petersburg who was hired by Viking Cruise Lines He was extremely Knowledgeable and full of amazing tidbits about Catherine and the palace itself. We also got early admission so we did not have to contend with vast crowds which really made it nice You could spend many more hours in there than we did but we saw a lot in spite of time restraints. Steps steps and more steps. Wear comfie shoes

Amber room is stunning. If you have time to venture to the village of Pushkin, you can choose to see Peterhof or Catherine Palace. There is no real point is visiting both. Catherine's palace has the added benefit of the amber room, which is very impressive. Beware of the long queues in summer and bring mosquito repellent!

Opulence at its best!. Stunning ..beautiful grounds.
Lots of walking!
We had a tremendous guide who took us through and explained the history and was well worth it!
Opulent living. Over the top opulence. Amazing to see the style of living by the privledged class. With real gold gilting, the restored rooms glittered. There were so many rooms and so well restored.

Cannot miss! Really stunning place.. It is truly an amazing place to visit. I was stunned by the gardens outside the palace and the palace itself. It is breathtaking. You can spend the whole day there

Amazing place. Visited with a knowledgeable tour guide. Beautiful palace, including gilded decorations and the amazing amber room. Fascinating to learn about the restoration work carried out by local people after WW2

Magnificent summer Palace of the Tsars. Another superb example of the restoration work carried out by the people of Russia after the palace was badly damaged during the Second World War. Fascinating photographs show the damage done to the Palace named after Catherine 1st, wife of Peter the Great. Superb Baroque style Palace with lovely gardens. Our excellent Russian guide provided plenty of facts about this magnificent Palace and ga dress. Visit the Amber workshop if you can. Fascinating! Arrive early as whilst it was still extremely busy the crowds queuing to get in when we were leaving were of music festival dimensions!

To much controls. Catherine palace is gilded in golds exterior and interior. Garden is very beautiful. However it is not impressive to me. It should be guided tour inside. We went independently buying black ticket which cost twice than ticket office to avoid long queue. However it is still much cheaper than tour from city. They are controlling movement inside palace just to follow a group.Ouside view is much enjoyable. It could be better to buy cheap park ticket to view buildings and gardens.
must visit. go early in the morning if you dont have entrance tickets,when we went the qeue was a mole long but dont give it a miss some beautiful things to look at

A splendid visit highlighted by our exceptionally knowledgable guide. We visited Catherine's palace and park on our recent visit to St Petersburg while aboard the Oceania Marina cruise linerWe toured Catherine's palace and the Peterhoff on one day which was hecticOur guide Irina P of tours by locals, once again managed the crowds unbelievably. At no time were we overwhelmed and when in the Amber Room, the highlight of the palace, we were almost the only visitors despite the lines outside.I must admit, when Irina mentioned that 11 cruise liners were docking on the day we docked I imagined shuffling around in a morass of touristsThis did not happen - thank you IrinaA splendid visit.
Awesome. So beautiful on the outside and inside, again narrated tour by Alexander of SPB tours, Pictures outside showing the damage and the renovation, wonderful day viewing the Palace

Czar Village. We went to Catherine Palace after lunch on Day1 of our SPB 2 DeLuxe Tour, by which time it was busy. Renovations of the church attached to the Palace are not yet complete, our guide hadn't yet been inside.As I have walking difficulties, I was taken upstairs via the lift. We had to put outer ' socks' over our shoes, to preserve the floor; or maybe it was ' to polish' it! It was very busy inside, but our guide kept us informed via the 'Whisper' system. This is a P.A system, whereby you wear an ear piece and the guide talks into a microphone. Excellent, as the guide isn't disturbing other groups.
Amaze myself with history on Catherine the Great.. The rooms are very luxurious and it's a good place for history buffs to learn about Catherine the Great.
BEAUTIFUL PALACE. This palace has all of the grqandeur and gold trimmings of all of Russian palaces. Again, the parquet floors are just beautiful works of art

the best of the summer palaces around St Petersburg. The restoration of the Catherine Palace is simply awesome. The almost mythical Amber Room, the fairytale hall of mirrors ... the gardens ... do not miss this wonderful palace and park.

Beautiful palace - hilight of our tour!. By far, this was our favorite stop on our St. Petersburg tour. The history and the architecture were simply amazing. We had a guide, and I recommend seeing the palace with a guide as her explanations enhanced the experienced so much - I know we would not have gotten as much enjoyment from it had we been touring on our own.While the palace is a ways from St Petersburg itself, it's well worth the time and distance to visit.

A fantasy become reality. What can one say that hasn't already been said. This is one of the world's great palaces. The fact that it has been restored from utter ruins is an amazing accomplishment in itself. Tours will seem rushed and they are. Be sure to spend sometime in the gardens...a quick tip, the gift shop is one of the most expensive in St. Petersburg but they do have some quality pieces. If you need budget souvenirs check out the lane right next to the Lyceum.

MUST SEE...BUT PL PLAN IT OUT. Timings are confusing . Pl be at the tkt counters least 1.5 to 2 hrs before your intended time of visit. Of course , you would find "agents" who have tkts procured well in advance , who are willing to part with them.. at a premium...Read up a lot...you will find very few English descriptions ...sadThe park itself is nice too..Recommend that you finish the palace visit first followed by the Gardens... at leisure...take the minibus from Moscovskaya metro stn..it is fast , efficient and very cheap

A beautiful palace. It would take all day to view the whole of this beautiful palace, I have never seen so much gold. Let me just say that the rooms are beautifully decorated and to ensure that you have a good viewing please check the visiting times before visiting as some times are reserved for groups

Restoration magic. On a perfect august morning I was entranced by this wonderful place. The amber room was spectacular but It is a shame the original was stolen and has not been found. The grounds were a riot of colour and so well maintained
very nice palace especially the marble room and te mirrorroom.. very nice must see. espescially the marble room. Beautifull gardens too, but the gardens of st petershof are more impressive.

Sumptuous palace.. We visited in the afternoon as part of a private tour. The palace is still a work in progress as restoration work is an ongoing process. The rooms that have been restored are sumptuous and impressive amounts of gold leaf have been used. A guide is essential as there are no information boards in the palace. There are two routes through the palace going in opposite directions and we were on the quiet side so in each room we were often the only ones on our side which was nice.The Amber room was perhaps less impressive than I had anticipated but it is amazing that it was restored using only black and white photographs as a guide.We also enjoyed a walk in the park afterwards which enabled us to appreciate the scale of the palace.

Not bad, but would depend on the wait.. Pretty amazing to see, and impressive. After a bit though, the rooms kind of tend to blend into one another. Either way...this is pretty eye opening. Probably worth the trip, if you don't have to wait 1+ hours in line.

Worth the trip. I thought this was a much better museum than the Hermitage (albeit different). The Palace itself is beautiful and the rooms are a treat to see. I agree with the others - the Amber room is a must see. The art is beautiful and well worth your time. Again, it's a lot of walking and no places to sit so if you're with people who have trouble walking, be prepared! I don't think there is an elevator either. Also there is a lot of stairs to be navigated and not a lot of hand rails. The gardens are nice and worth a walk around.

One of the Great Palaces in the World. We have traveled all over the world and this palace rivals any palace in the world. The palace and grounds are just amazing. The government has made a great effort to restore sections that were damaged by the war to their original stage. This is truly a great attraction for the entire family full of rich history. Make sure that you have a knowledgeable guide with you.

Nice, but very crowded. The Amber Room is amazing. Try to schedule a quick visit to the amber workshop to see how the artisans are still producing amber pieces. If you visit during the summer, expect the palace to be very very crowded.

Beautiful palace in baroque style. Catherine palace and Park are the best of all the palaces in St Petersburg.It is just outside the citty in Tsarsko Selo(Pushkin).It is fully restored to its former glory and well maintained. Built in Baroque styleThe amber Room is outstanding.It is one of the most beautiful palaces I have seen.It is better to go early before the crowds and have a guide who can explain everything.The park is also a beautiful place to spend some time.

Amazing and beautiful. Catherine's Palace really lived up to expectation. It was gorgeous and enormous. Tremendous amount of art in all mediums. Renovations done over the years all help preserve the 17th- and 18th-century look. Everything is incredibly well preserved. It's worth the trip!

Amber Room is a must see. The highlight of this palace is of course the famous Amber Room. We had a private guide that had ordered our tickets in advance but the queue to get in was still very long as there is not personnel checking ticket times and other groups were muscling their way in ahead of others. Besides the horrible experience trying to get in during our time slot, the palace was very nice. Highly recommend a trip to this palace during off season and don't forget to pick up an authentic amber souvenir from the gift shop.

More Opulence!. This palace and park is an example of the wealth and power of the Russian Royal family back in the old days. One is always in awe at what the extreme rich can attain no matter what the cost for the common folk. Nevertheless the beauty of the architecture remains a part of history.
A must visit. Amazing beauty and so historical!! It was like seeing a fairy tale castle. Well preserved, beauty abounds like no other and , efficiently organized.

Not to be missed!. History of Russia - do not miss this palace in Tsarsko Selo (Pushkin). Opulence, elegance, richness, gold, art - and the role of this extravagant spending in the history of Russia is a must to all visitors to St Petersburg.
Unbelievable. It's really unbelievable. Beautiful and over the top in its ornamentation. A must-see. As with all the major tourist sites in St. Petersburg, expect crowds, lines, and pickpockets.

Awesome Palace. Awesome place. It is over 1000 feet long. The Russians have done a great job restoring the main areas. They are still restoring parts of it but the main rooms are done fantastically! The facade has over 100 kg of gold gilding. The rooms are huge and amazing. They make you put on booties to walk inside. The crowds are large also. Had tourist groups from all around the world there. Loved it and would go back again.

Wonderful Palace to visit. Truly amazing palace, with wonderful landscaped gardens. Would always advise going with a guide who can arrange tickets and get you past the enormous queues. Well worth the money.

No wonder there was a revolution !. Trip advisor has this as a restaurant, it is not this is tour of the a palace in Russia.As you approach Catherine's Palace our tour guide explained how Catherine had the palace built and Catherine II did not think it was grand enough and built more. Once inside you are given shoe covers to protect the floor. Then you see the extremely beautiful wood work, paintings, murals, furnishings. Gold every where and it was not paint, it was gold. Very ostentatious, I had to keep reminding myself the Russian Royalty had no idea that the people of Russia were starving and living in poverty. Enough about my personal view. The grounds were beautiful and seemed to go on forever.

Definitely a must see. Not to be missed, however very crowded. A must is to have your tickets before you intend to visit so that you miss the endless line up for the entrance. Opened this year is the General Staff building - the art work here already is fantastic and the crowds are very small. Picasso, Monet painting are in this building

Well worth a visit. An amazing place but there are crowds of others with you when you visit your your visit is more like a route march! Having said that The Palace is beautiful & a must visit. The place is steeped in history and you can almost feel the Tzars etc of the past still in the place.

Impressive Summer palace. The grandeur is ever-present in every room you enter in this beautiful building. Before you go in they make you put on shoe protectors to keep the floors as perfect as possible, I am glad they do this as it could easily become ruined by thousands of tourists. You are also told to leave any bulky jackets in the cloak room, they provide hangers and give you a ticket to collect your jacket at the end. At the beginning there are photographs to show how much the Summer Palace had been damaged in World War 2, I was shocked and also amazed about how good it looks today. We had a guided tour and it was great as she told us interesting information about the items in each room and what the rooms were used for in the past. We had booked our tour from a cruise ship. Once we had seen the inside there were toilets available free of charge and they were clean. There was also a well-stocked gift shop with a good variety of souvenirs. Outside there are spacious gardens with fountains, we were lucky as we were outside when the music and fountain show started. I definitely recommend coming here to see how the Russian royalty lived.
fascinating . The palace is fascinating. the interiors are wonderfully crafted. the garden itself is such a beautiful serene place. another outstanding landmark of st. petersburg.

SUMPTUOUS BAROQUE ARCHITECTURE. We arrived independently, having purchased our tickets on-line before we left. We took the marshrutka from the metro, and even though we don't speak Russian, and the drivers don't speak English, you'll have no trouble getting there. Just mention "palaces". By purchasing tickets on-line and arriving before noon, you'll beat all the queues, enter via the tour groups entrance before everyone else and wander around in peace. There are no english audio guides, but you'll pick up enough from the other tour groups if you need to.My advice is: Do your research before you leave home.Do not miss this Palace !
Luxury. So fancy, a must see! Catherine really liked a lot of bling... In all seriousness though, a great sample of architecture, amount of detail in carvings and decorations is phenomenal

Guided tour. Very impressed by the palace, the various rooms and decorations especially the inlay wooden paneling on the floors, the marbles, jasper, lapis, malachite and vast collections of arts, vases, chandeliers. Very very overwhelmed by the massive building

18th - century Palace. Another landmark to visit in Pushkin - St. Petersburg. A historical monument of the summer residence of the Russian Tsars. Partially restored after being destroyed by Nazi German In World War II
Anaother great palace. We spent a few hours her and this was fantastic. Rooms mainly gold leaf. Gardens very pleasant. Again our lady guide was an essential part of the tour.

Catherine's complex att Pushkino.. Beautiful and massive complex. This should be an included part of any trip to St. Petersburg. The luxury and beauty of the palace complex is breathtaking. The amber room is especially striking.

Amazing. Simply best tour, breathtaking, helpful guide, great history to learn about and great venue for pictures
A MUST c in St Petersburg
great day at peterhof. we spent a lovely day at peterhof and surrounding areas. it was memorable. Natalia, our guide, was well informed and responded to all our questions with enthusiasm

Great place to visit while on a private tour. Visited on cruise stop with Insider Tours. Was asked not to take photos of the Amber room and a little heavy on the efforts of rebuilding after WWII destruction, but otherwise was really fun to go here and see the many rooms of this palace. Had 4 children and usually they dislike going to castles/palace but loved this place with all the different things to see here.
Must see!. You have to see it to believe it. Gives you more than a glimpse of what life was like for them. Definitely leaves an impression.

Outstanding palace!!!. This palace has so many things to admire. The outside and the gardens are really amazing but the inside is so beautiful and attractive, specially the amber room which is the most impressive of all, the pictures I've seen do not make justice to this room, unfortunately it is very crowded and they allow only a few minutes to stay in the room. In this palace you can find great things to admire on the floor, the walls and the ceiling. It is located a little bit far from St. Petesburg but it is worth the trip.
Catherine's Palace. Magnificent Palace including the grounds. A big tourist attraction but definitely worth the visit and plan to spend adequate time as there is much to see.

awesome and spectacular.. This place was simply awesome and breathtaking. Each room was better and more spectacular than the last. The last room was the Amber room which was really amazing and the only minus was that we were rushed away due to the crowds and I would have liked more time to appreciate the work that was truly fabulous.the gardens were also work a mention but alas, lack of time on an excursion did not allow us to appreciate it more.

Great but give it a whole day. Lovely place and architecture. Very interesting insight into Catherine II's tastes. But we only gave ourselves half a day, which was not long enough to see the Alexander park/palace, Catherine gardens and the Palace!
The place to visit. This is where we spent almost half a day. There is so much to see here that even a full day may not be enough. Its Exotic, Rich and very Informative
Wonderful St Petersburg.. Beautiful building , inside and out. The decoration inside is breath-taking ,gold-leaf everywhere! You go from one sumptuous room to another.
Very intersting visit. It was the summer residence of the Russian tsars. It must be visited. It is amazing for luxury and grandeur.

One of the 2 or 3 "must see" sites. It's a Pushkin and not St Petersburg so it's a 45 minute drive. But worth it. If you are going to see one palace, this is the one. Don't miss the imperial carriages.

Incredible but ram packed. We took the metro to Moskovskaya metro/train station (don't get confused with another nearer station on same line with similar name) on blue line two. The main railway station has an impressive courtyard with a large statue and fountains. There is a road between that and the station and here you will find plenty of marshrutkas going to Detskoe Selo and Pushkin. Many have these destinations in Latin script. They cost R40 per person. If you have any problem ask a young, professionally dressed person as they will often speak a little English. On the way back we got dropped at the end of the line two metro line which makes me think that you can probably also get minibus taxis from here too. The journey is about 20 minutes and we were dropped right by the entrance to the palace. We got the return minibus from exactly the same place- not the opposite side of the road as you might think. We had prebooked tickets for Monday (with late opening til 9pm) but in the event at 4pm when we arrived there were no queues. There did not appear to be any restrictions on the time of individual visits, despite all the guide books stating the contrary. To redeem our prebooked tickets we went to a booth near the main entrance to the courtyard. This is to the far right of building as you look at it from the street. There are lots of stalls selling reasonably priced souvenirs and snacks as well as a couple of cafes on the short walk to the palace. Inside it was pandemonium. Chinese tour groups were charging about all over the place, knocking people on the heads with their ubiquitous selfie sticks and blocking entrance and exit to narrow rooms. I'm generally pretty tolerant of tourist destinations but I got to the point of feeling like I wanted to scream. The problem is that there is one route round the building and most of the rooms are roped off leaving a very narrow channel for the flow of people who are not always considerate of others or their surroundings. One woman was so busy swinging her arms about for a posed photo she nearly knocked over a huge vase to a look of absolute horror from the Russian museum worker nearby. That said, the palace is amazing and the Amber Room alone is worth all the hassle. Even more amazing is that this exquisite gem of craftsmanship was left a gutted, burnt out, ruined shell by Nazi occupation at the end of WW2 and has been lovingly and painstakingly restored with the help of a little German cash. It really brought tears to my eyes trying to understand how something so special and precious could be senselessly trashed. As you exit down a long corridor on the ground floor there are a series of photos with commentary in English about the war and the restoration process which are well worth a read. The curators undertook a massive effort to evacuate the palace's treasures and even as German divisions were pulling into Pushkin they continued to bury artefacts in the grounds. Finally they walked back to Leningrad under fire. I'm sure the British Museum's staff are equally passionate but I can't imagine them going to these lengths. After a footsore and rather exasperating experience inside it was lovely to come out into the exquisite grounds for a wander. We were on a whistle stop tour but given more time I would suggest bringing a picnic and enjoying the grounds before braving tourist mayhem inside. You can hire bikes apparently which is a great idea as the area is large but by the time we re-emerged in the early evening I could not see any rental places open. There are a few stalls selling coffee etc in the grounds.

I must be too jaded about palaces. Ok -- you are in St. Petersburg wondering what to do. You have been to Peterhof (Peter's restored palace) and the Hermitage (Catherine's Winter Palace), and you have traveled in Europe to see a myriad of other palaces (Versailles for example). This is another palace with opulent Baroque rooms and opulent dining sets. The Amber room here is the only unique aspect of this palace.This palace is a restoration of what it used to be. The Germans destroyed it in the war. They cut down trees, dragged them into the palace and set the trees on fire. It took quite an effort by the Russians to painstakingly recreate this palace.Now, if you go, be prepared for incredibly long lines and interminable waiting. If it's raining, you will likely be waiting in the rain just to get to the front door. I'm getting palaced out -- the lines and waiting here were not worth it. Maybe 2 hours of waiting outside and inside for about 30 minutes (or less) of touring the palace. See the Hermitage and Peterhof first. Then decide if you want to go to Catherine's palace , which is about 45 minutes or so outside of St. Petersburg.
Catherine the Great Was Both Rich & Famous. This Palace and Park was where Catherine the Great spent her summers. It is definitely worth a guided tour.
While in St. Petersburg, Don't Miss Catherine's Palace. While visiting the Hermitage, be sure to make time to visit Catherine's Palace. The architecture is truly spectacular!
Catherine's Palace. just fabulous...a definite MUST!!!! very overwhelming. should go with guide. Don't miss this. it is very special.

How Do Your Write About This Place? Incredible Is the Only Way to Describe It.... Catherine's Palace is beyond belief ... architecturally a masterpiece with blazing colors accented by gold leaf throughout. The Empress wanted to have a home to impress her foreign visitors, and she certainly succeeded. The price, however, was paid by her people who were heavily taxed and massively repressed by the Romanov Dynasty for the more than three centuries they ruled "all of the Russias" with an iron fist. One can easily appreciate, however, that this palace - and many others echoing its opulence in St. Petersburg, the capital of the Russian Empire - served as an effective beacon to Western Europe that Russia was no longer going to remain a huge country of little real import on the world stage.

Wonderful experience..a look back at history. Catherine Palace has to be on your itinerary when visiting St Petersburg with all its grandeur, opulence and history. A tour guide is a must as the Russian Guides take visitors round two or three times a week and are well versed in all the Palace has to offer. We visited beginning of July and already it was extremely busy and you felt you were being rushed from room to room (sometimes pushed) which was a shame as there is so much to see and take in we would have liked to have had more time. Even so, we would not have missed the wonderful experience of seeing Catherine Palace.

Incredible restoration and worth the drive to see. We had a private tour guide who walked is through but the group tours look great as well. Incredible restoration and history of this palace. It is immaculately restored from the destruction during WWII. To put things in perspective take your time during the end where they show pictures of the destruction and the restoration work in progress. Also walk the garden which is also impressive.
A magnificent palace. Catherine's Palace is mammoth is size and is beautiful to see. A must visit when travelling to St. Petersburg

The secret to speedy admittance is Booth 3.. The lines are impossible. However, for 1500 rubles, one can obtain what in Russian is known as a "comfort" ticket at Booth 3. Not only are the lines at Booth 3 drastically shorter, but this ticket permits one to walk right in at any time through a side entrance rather than waiting on line for a timed entry.

Must do whilst in St Petes. If you are visiting St Petersburg then I would recommend a visit to Catherine Palace. In my opinion it is always worth having a guide. We were lucky and had a guide to ourselves. She was very knowledgable and able to answer all our questions. I really enjoyed learning about the history of the place and Catherine in particular. It's a shame there is not more furniture to give a sense of what the palace was like when lived in but unfortunately the Nazis destroyed/looted most of it.Very opulent.
wonderful. It is a Catherine palace rebuilt after the second world war with unique paintings and decorations.A very beautiful park is around it and you can enjoy walking.
Stunning. You must visit this place, it is amazing inside and outside. Even though the outside of the building is under repair it still shows off its beauty
extravagant. Definitely a must see when visiting St. Petersburg. Each room is filled with gold. Great to see a moment in the time of Catherine!

impressive. like so many other sites within st petersburg, this palace was not ony stunning, it is a beauty , a place to retreat, a kind of fairy-tale, but best: you can visit it (with many other interested tourists)book a tour, we did a private one and that was highly enjyable because with 2 people only one hears better, walks better, is faster and has more fun . Price is fineyou are confronted with a palace built in baroque style and further enhanced by the following tsars and their families, an absolute fabulous mixture

It's all about the park. The palace - well as our guide aptly put it "In Russia, if it looks like gold, it is gold!" so how many gold decorated rooms must you endure before you grasp that it's good to be a Tsar and own all the country's natural resources? So skip the crowds and pictures (because they will really all look the same) and spend time walking the grounds of the beautiful garden. It's magical and laid out so well. We loved it and was upset that our guide insisted we see the palace. We found it hard to "go rogue" with our Russian tour guide... Like she was not comfortable with that al all.

Better than Versailles. The Catherine Palace is an amazing and beautiful place. It was both incredible in size and in decoration. While it can be crowded, it is worth it to see the richly decorated rooms, as well as those that are more understated. The Amber room is of course, a sight to behold.

historical palace 30 km south of the city. Beatifull palace. Advice to go with a local tour operator, easy to book on the Newsky Prospect; otherwise you risk to wait long for buying your entrance ticket. English speaking guide included.
Lovely. This was a terrific stop. I loved the exterior, but the interior really wowed. It was amazing what a transformation it made since it was nearly destroyed in 1945.

One of the Must sees around St. Petersburg. We were taken around by a private guide who was superb. The many rooms were beautiful, especially the amber room. The grounds were also very lovely and enjoyed walking around the many sites. You could not go to St. Petersburg and not visit even though very busy most of the time, with very long queues for tickets if you haven't pre-arranged.

Stunning palace and Amber room !. The place is about 1 hour from St Petersburg, you can either take a private tour or if you are more of an adventure seeker you can traverse on your own through metro and bus/train to reach here. There are two entrances, one to the park and another one to the museum and the tour to the museum is in slots which grants access to the well preserved palace. Inside the palace are grand rooms with the best room being one of the kind in the world Amber room. The place is huge and requires some stamina to visit each and everything.

Stunning and huge, not be missed!. Puschkin (Tsarskoe Selo) was one of the highlights of our visit to St Petersburg. You need the whole day to visit the huge Catherina Palace and walk in enormous park with regular French gardens and landscape English par with a lot of buildings and statues (for example Grotto pavilion, Creaking Pagoda and many other, all of them worth while of seeing.) Do not miss the concert of the Russian choir who are singing church and folk music in the Grotto pavilion in the Park. There is also the Alexander Palace, Alexander Park and Lyceum nearby. The magnificent Cathearina Palace is one of the best examples of the Baroque style. The Palace was originally created by Italian architect Bartolomeo Rastrelli in 18th century for the Empress Elizabeth (daughter of the Peter the Great), but later redesigned by Scottish architect Charles Cameron for the Empress Ekaterina the Great. Severely damaged during WWII it has been restored carefully late. The palace is huge and glorious with and one breathtaking room after the next, lavishly decorated with gold, marble and precious fabrics. The famous Amber room that was plundered and mysteriously disappeared during WWII is now restored in its glory. From the Cameron's Gallery surrounded with beautiful gardens with a lot of flowers you can enjoy amazing views of the park and the palaces and the Ascension Cathedral with it golden domes. It is famous destination for tourists and thus rather crowded. In my opinion it is worthwhile to take an organized tour from the Petersburg, which allows you to escape the huge line to the palace. The two guides who we had were very qualified. There are many kiosks in the park selling hot drinks, sandwiches and sweets. The numerous souvenirs shop are rather expensive, it is better to buy some amber and matrershka in the city.

Incredible. There are fixed time slots for you to go in. And we were with a toddler and had to check in our stroller etc. which was a bit inconvenient.
